title: Student Guide
content: Student Guide Welcome to Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University (IZU) We are delighted to welcome all international students to IZU. To ensure a smooth transition into university life, we highly recommend reviewing International Student Guide. This guide contains essential information, and students are expected to familiarise themselves with its contents as they will be held responsible for details provided. It is also mandatory to join official WhatsApp group for international students. If you have not yet been added, please get in touch with International Office, located at entrance of School of Languages. Contact International Office Phone : +90 212 692 9622 WhatsApp : +90 505 182 4316 Email : international@izu.edu.tr Address : Halkalı Campus, School of Languages, The International Office is located in rooms DL 033-034, on right side when you enter School of Languages building. Our office hours are from 09:30 to 16:30, Monday to Friday. We provide support in multiple languages to assist you in any way we can. We are here to help you settle in and make most of your time at IZU!

title: IZU Central Library, The Greatest Library in Istanbul has been opened.
content: IZU Central Library, The Greatest Library in Istanbul has been opened. 20.05.2018 After completion of its construction, new Central Library of Sabahattin Zaim University in Istanbul has been opened. With a 13.500 square meters of area of usage, 1500 researching attendees and 1 million book capacity, IZU Central Library is now greatest library in Istanbul and stands out as one of largest in Turkey. IZU Central Library now being heart of University continues to maintain scientific legacy of Halkali Agriculture and Veterinary School and Mehmet Akif Ersoy. The Central Library provides access to knowledge to university’s academicians and students in a very comfortable environmant and is already one of most essential place in institution’s grounds. IZU Central Library will continue to serve for 24 hours during final exams.

title: International Collaborations
content: Collaborations The Erasmus + Student Mobility Program is a higher education program aimed at increasing quality of higher education in Europe envisaging "international mobility of university students" by encouraging cooperation between universities from different countries. The Erasmus program is financed by European Union students receives a grant chance to study in different European countries for a certain period of time. The Erasmus program is coordinated by IZU Office. İstanbul Sabahattin Zaim has Erasmus + agreement with 38 universities in 20 countries. Up to now(today), a total of 70 students have successfully completed Erasmus study internship mobility program. Our students benefited from mobility in almost all European countries, especially in Germany, France, Italy Poland. At same time IZU accepts a great number of exchange students from Europe every semester with programs offering 100% 30% English. In addition to Erasmus program, we are developing collaborations with important universities from other parts of world. These cooperation programs include student-academic exchanges, joint symposia conferences, joint research projects, master's PHD’s.Some of these cooperation agreements are; Major American universities such as Duke Mary Washington, our students have opportunity to be a student of change, take (taking)summer courses take(taking) advantage of English language education.For Department of Sciences, where Arabic language education is important,we have agreements with of Jordan World Science & Education in Jordan.In Addition conferences are held every year in with Universiti Utara Malaysia. title: About the 2020-2021 Spring Term PhD Qualifying(Comprehensive) Exam Schedule
content: About 2020-2021 Spring Term PhD Qualifying(Comprehensive) Exam Schedule 29.03.2021 Dear Student, Students who wish to apply for PhD qualifying exam to be held in spring semester of 2020-2021 academic year are required to fill in application form below in computer environment between 19 April 2021 and apply to Graduate School Secretariat together with their language proficiency and ALES results. Applications can be made to relevant Institute official by mail or by hand delivery to Institute Secretariat at Halkalı Campus. Click for PhD Qualifying Exam Application Form. (Unsigned documents will not be accepted.) Click for e-mail addresses of relevant Institute officials. Doctoral Qualifying Exams will be held in June 2021, and date and time will be decided by relevant head of program. How exams will be conducted will be announced later on. (online or face to face) ISSUES TO BE CONSIDERED Students who have completed their courses and seminars, have a cumulative grade point average of at least 3.00 and have fulfilled their Foreign Language Proficiency may apply for doctoral proficiency exam. Students who are accepted with a master's degree have to take doctoral qualifying exam by end of fifth semester at latest, following relevant regulations. Students who did not apply for PhD Qualifying Exam held in fall semester of 2020-2021 academic year or failed exam must apply again on specified dates. Students who do not apply will be deemed unsuccessful and will be dismissed from University.

content: Erasmus+ Staff Mobility Activities STAFF From ABROAD Are you interested in teaching or training at IZU? View pages for incoming staff STAFF From IZU Are you interested in teaching or training abroad? View pages for outgoing staff General Information Staff Mobility for Teaching Erasmus+ supports teaching periods at higher education institutions (HEIs) abroad. If you work in higher education, you can spend time teaching at an institution in an Erasmus+ Programme or Partner country. Teaching opportunites are also available to staff working in Programme country organisations. Examples of such organisations include businesses, public bodies, social partners, research institutes. Staff Mobility for Training Erasmus+ supports training periods for staff working in higher education institutions. With Erasmus+, you can train at a higher education institution in an Erasmus+ Programme or Partner country or at an organisation outside the sector in a Programme country. Examples of such organisations include businesses, public bodies, social partners, research institutes and non-governmental organisations.

Boşver “Give empty” Perhaps my favorite saying, Boşver means “let it go,” a la Frozen. 14. El elden üstündür “A hand is superior to another person’s hand” Said to show there’s always do a better job. 15. Battı balık yan gider “A sunken fish goes sideways” one’s pretty hard to parse, but it means worst-case scenario already happened (the fish sunk), so might as well stop worrying some fun! 16. Ateş almaya gelmek “Coming over just a light” cheekily accuse a visitor of want them to stay a while longer. 17. Cami yıkılmış ama mihrab yerinde ”The mosque is a ruin but mihrap is standing” One of my personal favorites, phrase describes an older woman retains her charms. It’s like saying a church is in ruins but pulpit is standing. Basically, it’s opposite of “mutton dressed as lamb.” 18. Geçmiş olsun it be past” Said is sick or had a bad experience. I love how it recognizes someone’s pain, but expresses hope it soon be behind them. 19. Nazar değmesin be touched by evil eye” Said after giving a compliment, particularly to a child. Although I’m a pretty rational person, I do believe in power of evil eye use saying a lot. 20. Hayırlı olsun it be auspicious” Said whenever a new undertaking, such as a new job. 21. Allah analı babalı büyütsün God let him/her grow up both a mom dad” Perhaps most meaningful thing could wish a newborn child. 22. Kolay gelsin ”May it be easy you” is a great way to acknowledge another person’s labors, even a stranger on street, a difficult task at hand. 23. Çok yaşa live long” “bless you,” çok yaşa is said after sneezes. sneezer then replies sende gör (may see my life) or hep beraber (may we years to live). 24. Kafayı üşüttü “They’ve caught a cold in head” Turks a congenital fear of catching a chill, which strike any part of body. If you’ve caught a cold in head, it means you’ve gone crazy. 25. Sıhhatler olsun it bring health” Older generations grew up before hot running water in homes, only had baths once or twice a week, say come out of shower in case catch a chill (see above). 26. Başınız sağolsun head stay healthy” A thoughtful way of wishing condolences they grieving loss of a loved one. 27. (Benim) ilk göz ağrım “The first pain of my eye” is said to a first love or first child to avoid giving them evil eye (I used to feel very jealous my grandmother said to my brother, her oldest grandchild.) 28. Ellerine sağlık “Health to hand” Said to created something beautiful hands, particularly to a cook or a mom after she’s cooked up a feast her family. 29. Bir musibet bin nasihatten iyidir “One bad experience is worth a thousand warnings” No explanation needed. 30. Güle güle gidin go laughing” is said to departing visitors to help take edge off sad goodbyes.

title: Apply to IZU
content: Apply to IZU Application Requirements Applications candidates graduated school or are in final year meet following criteria be considered: Foreign nationals, Those were nationals but later acquired citizenship, Those were born as but later renounced citizenship with permission Ministry of Interior, as well as minor children registered in renunciation document, provided they can certify that they hold Document on Exercise of Rights Granted under Citizenship Law (According to Article 7 of Citizenship Law No. 5901: “(1) A child born in or outside Turkey to a citizen mother father within a marriage is considered a citizen.”), entire in a country (excluding Republic of Northern Cyprus - TRNC) or in located in countries, reside in there with GCE A-Level exam results, as well as enrolled in colleges or between 2005-2010 obtained or are eligible to obtain GCE A-Level results, or entire in a country hold a TR-YÖS exam result. Applications candidates meeting following conditions be accepted: entire in Turkey or TRNC, (except entire in obtained GCE A-Level results, enrolled in colleges or between 2005-2010 obtained or obtain GCE A-Level results, or entire in a country hold a TR-YÖS result), Dual whose first nationality at birth was (except entire in a country excluding or in abroad), Dual citizens, one of whose nationalities is (except entire in obtained GCE A-Level results, enrolled in colleges or between 2005-2010 obtained or obtain GCE A-Level results, or entire in a country hold a TR-YÖS result), former (including Blue Card holders) nationals enroll in institutions 2022-2023 academic year onward (except studying in embassy schools, international private educational institutions listed in MOBİS system, nationals brought to Turkey under projects conducted by Ministry of National Education), or dual whose first nationality at birth was are studying at affiliated with embassies in Turkey or at in Turkey, Those been expelled a higher institution in Turkey due to disciplinary action. (2) University entrance exams (e.g., SAT, ACT, TCS, etc.) are valid two years . title: Residence Permit
content: Residence Permit Residence Permit تصريح الإقامة İkamet İzni Students enrolled in an academic program in Türkiye three months or longer are obliged to acquire a student per Law on Foreigners International Protection. The Student Residence Permit allows to stay in Türkiye during study period. All international students, regardless of their status, must apply student within a month of their arrival to Türkiye. To do this, need to make an online submit files. Our Office is responsible taking our students' files to Directorate General of Migration Management. Therefore, student must submit their documents to International Office within A WEEK after applying, in a complete accurate manner . Required Documents: Pink file (Legal Transactions File) Four (4) passport-size photographs Two (2) FILLED Declaration Form s Student Application Form obtained official website of Immigration Department with fingerprint criminal number -Copy of passport or equivalent documents (pages containing personal information) - Last entry stamp to Turkey (for first-time applications) - Copy of previous (for extension transfer applications) Student Certificate in Turkish (obtained through Campus System ) Document that shows information where reside: For extension requests: ● Residence document obtained ( E-Government ) For first-time applications: ● If are house owner : A copy of property deed ● If are a tenant : A copy of valid notarized lease agreement ● If residing in a student dormitory/hotel or similar : ○ Document proving in a student dormitory (with QR code or "Signature Circulars" document) ○ Or a document proving stay in hotel a receipt indicating accommodation payment ● If residing with a sponsor : ○ A notarized commitment letter sponsor to student (if sponsor is married, a notarized commitment letter spouse as well) ○ A document sponsor obtainable ( E-Government ) ○ Birth certificate model sponsor if sponsor holds Turkish citizenship. ○ Residence document obtained ( E-Government ) Valid health insurance: ● General health insurance (made within first three (3) months after entering country), ● Or Private Health Insurance covering period. Residence Permit Payment Receipt ( Payment be made online or at Tax Office) Addresses of foreigners UETS: * Passport foreign ID number * GSM number * You obtain it PTT branches after providing a valid email filling out UETS form Foreigners with an electronic signature be able to apply UETS online at https://www.etebligat.gov.tr/ . Any other document that may be requested by Immigration Office. Make sure to bring passport with to International Office. To Provide Fingerprints, Students Must Bring Following Documents:(If It’s written in Application Form don’t need to obtain it again) Student Application Form obtained website https://e-ikamet.goc.gov.tr/. Copy of passport or equivalent documents (pages containing personal information). Student Certificate - in Turkish (obtained through campus system electronically signed). And go to one of these centers: Directorate General of Migration Management in Istanbul (İstanbul İl Göç İdaresi Müdürlüğü) Presidency of Working Group in Esenyurt (Esenyurt İlçe Çalışma Grubu Başkanlığı) Kumkapı Coordination Center (Kumkapı Koordinasyon Merkezi) Presidency of Working Group in Pendik (Pendik İlçe Çalışma Grubu Başkanlığı) Presidency of Working Group in Sultanbeyli (Sultanbeyli İlçe Çalışma Grubu Başkanlığı) Note: Files without fingerprints be separated as incomplete documents, files be returned submission after fingerprints are taken. For Students Under 18 Years Old: For those arriving with visa exemption or a visa a different purpose: Document containing parent/guardian information (birth certificate, family certificate, etc.). Consent letter parent/guardian/legal representative, a commitment letter third party provided by parent/guardian. For those arriving with a student visa: No consent letter or document containing parent/guardian information be required. For Erasmus students, situation is exactly same no different procedures be applied to them. RESIDENCE PERMIT CARD FEE PAYMENT You make payment online via Credit Card by following below instructions: 1. Visit Dijital Vergi Dairesi (gib.gov.tr) 2. Click on “ Göç İdaresi İkamet Tezkeresi Harcı Ödeme ” button. 3. Type Tahakkuk no (Accrue no) into “ Başvuru Numarası ” box then verification code as seen below in “ Güvenlik Kodu ” box. Accrue no is indicated in online form (1st page). 4. Please download print receipt once are done with payment. If cannot pay online: You must first obtain a tax ID number then pay it at any Tax Office. The personnel might not be able to speak English. Therefore, bring this message to anyone, they help you: “Merhaba! Ben İstanbul Sabahattin Zaim Üniversitesinden geliyorum. Yabanci Uyrukluyum. İkamet kart ücreti ödemeye geldim. Yardiminiz icin tesekkurler.” (Hello! I study at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University am a foreigner. I came here to pay my fee. Thank help in advance.) An only be made after entering Türkiye registering at university. Residence applications made abroad are invalid. Students cannot leave Türkiye before obtaining document. Departing Türkiye before receiving results in rejection. Students are responsible prolonging their according to their study period if needed. Student passport must be valid at least 60 days beyond requested ending date of permit. Make sure passport is valid six months minimum. If already have a short-term permit, make a “transfer application” student permit. If are coming another university in Türkiye to Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University, must update registration information within 20 days at Kumkapı Migration Coordination. It is essential to maintain accurate current information in university records at all times. This includes promptly updating at Student Affairs whenever any changes occur. Due to high number of applications, we suggest complete online in evening, out of working hours. Please keep a copy of form yourself so that track status. WHEN DO I GET MY RESIDENCE PERMIT CARD? The Immigration Administration is fully authorized to approve or reject to mail to you. The period between processing of receipt of may take up to 30-45 days. Once Immigration Office goes over files approves file, confirmation SMS / email approval be sent to you. After receiving message, be printed posted by Immigration Office. Your is delivered to contact by official carrier, PTT. You must be ready at provided in form to receive card. The mail carrier not hand over to anyone other than you. If postman cannot find at address, PTT return to Immigration Directorate. You see result on http: //e-ikamet.goc.gov.tr/Ikamet/DevamEdenBasvuruGiris only after evaluation of immigration authority. Login to system by entering mobile number or e-mail passport number that used in along with number. The result of evaluation (positive or negative) appear on screen. If is approved, click on "post tracking" link on same page to find out printing status of card. If has not been printed yet, barcode number give an error. If it is printed, follow delivery stage of according to barcode number. To receive card, make sure provide correct on form. After receiving card, please bring it to Student Affairs. Attention: You cannot leave Türkiye without obtaining card. If do so, receive a penalty depending on case; moreover, be cancelled by Immigration Office.

title: ECHE and Policy Statement
content: ECHE Policy Statement Policy Statement As a newly established university in 2010, Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University (IZU) gives a high priority to have a multicultural multilingual campus. Being a part of Programme provides us more potentials in order to achieve campus environment certain level of student staff mobility in order to develop multilateral cooperation, an understanding of compatible European Education Area recent innovations. Acting vision of being an research university, closely follows dynamics has set itself following objectives within Programme: 1-To create an campus environment by contributing to recognition of University at national level: Although is a university can be considered young, it offers a multinational campus environment 20% 11% academics. currently has more than 2200 from 91 countries. We believe participation in Programme contribute to multinational multilingual campus environment. 2-To strengthen in foreign languages as well as increasing numbers of academics quantitatively qualitatively: 27% of study programs at provide in a foreign language, this lead University to increase its ability in cooperating at an level. In addition, we created a common portfolio of courses all can follow, to support in a foreign language. Thanks to these courses University has a more preferable position by stakeholders. 3-To increase number of staff participating in Programme: We are fully aware of importance of mobility for both staff, is why we plan to expand activities in this area. We wish to send host from each of three cycles, but main target for next years are 1st 2nd cycle students. As an internationalizing institution, welcomes staff from all around world. In such a multicultural environment, we are committed to ensure non-discrimination of gender, race, religion, disabled etc., zero tolerance is implemented for discrimination of any kind as of establishment of institution. The Executive Board ensure it stays in way. 4-To partner many institutions aiming to strengthen cooperation relationships diversify them in different geographies: Partnerships established within Programme enable student staff mobility, as well as providing intellectual scientific cooperation between institutions. permanently searches for new partners to catch up new developments in higher education. We believe increased level of quality by working new different partners brings benefits both for institution partners. aims to cooperate at least one university in each Programme Country at least one university from each region in Partner Countries. 5-To interexchange good practices innovation in cooperation partners: intends to increase its internationalization through mobility activities as well as projects within Programme. We aim to attract cooperation projects researchers from across European extend learning opportunities to every place higher is valued. KA-2 projects, which are among future plans, support internationalization of institution as well as its modernization increase in knowledge, quality, innovation capacity. 6-To support personal professional development of staff: One of internationalization objectives is staff acquire personal professional skills through activities. Participation in Programme significantly contribute to foreign language skills future employability of staff. Promoting active citizenship civic engagement, tolerance cultural awareness mobility activities are in line mission values of IZU. 7-To reach European standards continuous improvement in service quality: confirms participating in Programme is part of its modernization internationalization strategy. It acknowledges contribution of student staff mobility as a key to quality of its higher programmes student experience. Our efforts to adapt European Education Area, starting Bologna Declaration, be supported by mobility activities as a part of process. In this context, activities be open for testing developing Programme in order to improve service quality processes. We also take necessary steps for Erasmus Without Paper, Online Learning Agreement Online IIA etc. under European Student Card Initative to digitize implementation processes become more efficient. Objectives mentioned above are guidelines for achieving aims of high standards are in line Internationalization Strategy of IZU. Our modernization efforts, which started process of Bologna Declaration, be supported participation as a beneficiary institution of Programme. title: Counseling and Guidance
content: Psychological Counseling Guidance Psychological Counseling Guidance Unit is a unit affiliated to Department of Health, Culture Sports. The counseling service is provided in office which is in Halkalı Campus. The Psychological Counseling Guidance Unit has two psychologists working full-time part-time. In Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University Psychological Counseling Guidance Unit, purpose is to support students; individual, social, academic professional development as well as to help their adaptation to university dormitory life, to help them gain necessary skills to cope with various problems that may arise during this process. Our Psychological Counseling Guidance Unit helps our students to understand themselves their environment better, helps them to discover their skills to develop their interpersonal communication skills. The academic administrative staff of Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University can also receive individual counseling from Psychological Counseling Guidance Unit. All services provided in Psychological Counseling Guidance Unit are free of charge. All activities carried out in unit are based on principle of confidentiality. However, if life of interviewee or someone they know is in danger, necessary people are contacted, student will be informed about contact. The Issues That Can Be Given Help Through Psychological Counselling (The Issues That Students Might Need Support from The Counselling Office) • Adaptation to University and/or Dormitory • Self-Confidence Issues • Test Anxiety • Fears Anxiety • Negativism Trust Issues • Conflicts within Family • Relationship Issues • Depression • Eating Disorders • Substance Abuse • Similar Issues Above If you are facing any of issues above or similar issues, please contact counselling services between 09:30 – 17:00 Merve ÖZKAN, Psychologist Phone: (0212) 692 9748 E-Mail: ozkan.merve@izu.edu.tr Days Available: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday Huriye ÇEVİK, Clinical Psychologist Office: Health Culture Sports Department Phone: (0212) 692 9748 E-Mail: huriye.cevik@izu.edu.tr Only available on Wednesdays

title: Student Clubs
content: Student Clubs We have 33 student clubs active in IZU. In addition to these clubs, we have a total of 9 Students Community's. Student Clubs and Student Communities have the opportunity to work with a team spirit by organizing many activities in; cultural, social, and sports area both inside and outside the campus. The experience and achievements of our students in these club and society activities, form an important place in their educational lives, as they also contribute positively to their professional skills. During the year, various activities such as; conferences, sports tournaments, workshops and trips suitable for the purpose of the clubs are organized. Clubs and Communities work intensively at student festivals held at the end of the year.

title: President's Message
content: How IZU made me feel like home Being in Istanbul makes feel like are in heart of world, but being at IZU makes heart of world feel like home. Even after only spending a few weeks here, I just know that Erasmus- but especially Erasmus here, has been one of best decisions of my life. Apart from amazing University programs classes, IZU has made most welcoming heartwarming atmosphere for me. Attending classes club programs University has prepared for us gives emphasis on how much they care about diversity of social educational life of their students. No matter what study what your days look like, can always find time get interested into something that is going on in campus. Who would even dare to describe Istanbul all its wonders? If I may, first thing I would say that it is tireless makes fall in love with life even more. It is impossible to get to know it in a short time, it seeks out to wander around. Orientation week gave us a perfect glimpse into adventure that was ahead of us. From mesmerizing cuisine, epic history tradition, cultural sights charming overall energy of city. Being alone in a city that could easily be described as capital of world has not bee lonely even for a moment. Just knowing that have a such an amazing group of friends made here, most wonderful university where are never bored, someone looking out for at all times is a thing that will stick with you- always. Dear IZU, I just got here, I already don't know how I will ever leave… Sincerely, Edita Krušlin

title: ECHE and Policy Statement
content: ECHE Policy Statement Policy Statement As a newly established university in 2010, Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University (IZU) gives a high priority to have a multicultural multilingual campus. Being a part of Programme provides us more potentials in order to achieve campus environment certain level of student staff mobility in order to develop multilateral cooperation, an understanding of compatible European Education Area recent innovations. Acting vision of being an research university, closely follows dynamics has set itself following objectives within Programme: 1-To create an campus environment by contributing to recognition of University at national level: Although is a university can be considered young, it offers a multinational campus environment 20% 11% academics. currently has more than 2200 from 91 countries. We believe participation in Programme contribute to multinational multilingual campus environment. 2-To strengthen in foreign languages as well as increasing numbers of academics quantitatively qualitatively: 27% of study programs at provide in a foreign language, this lead University to increase its ability in cooperating at an level. In addition, we created a common portfolio of courses all can follow, to support in a foreign language. Thanks to these courses University has a more preferable position by stakeholders. 3-To increase number of staff participating in Programme: We are fully aware of importance of mobility for both staff, is why we plan to expand activities in this area. We wish to send host from each of three cycles, but main target for next years are 1st 2nd cycle students. As an internationalizing institution, welcomes staff from all around world. In such a multicultural environment, we are committed to ensure non-discrimination of gender, race, religion, disabled etc., zero tolerance is implemented for discrimination of any kind as of establishment of institution. The Executive Board ensure it stays in way. 4-To partner many institutions aiming to strengthen cooperation relationships diversify them in different geographies: Partnerships established within Programme enable student staff mobility, as well as providing intellectual scientific cooperation between institutions. permanently searches for new partners to catch up new developments in higher education. We believe increased level of quality by working new different partners brings benefits both for institution partners. aims to cooperate at least one university in each Programme Country at least one university from each region in Partner Countries. 5-To interexchange good practices innovation in cooperation partners: intends to increase its internationalization through mobility activities as well as projects within Programme. We aim to attract cooperation projects researchers from across European extend learning opportunities to every place higher is valued. KA-2 projects, which are among future plans, support internationalization of institution as well as its modernization increase in knowledge, quality, innovation capacity. 6-To support personal professional development of staff: One of internationalization objectives is staff acquire personal professional skills through activities. Participation in Programme significantly contribute to foreign language skills future employability of staff. Promoting active citizenship civic engagement, tolerance cultural awareness mobility activities are in line mission values of IZU. 7-To reach European standards continuous improvement in service quality: confirms participating in Programme is part of its modernization internationalization strategy. It acknowledges contribution of student staff mobility as a key to quality of its higher programmes student experience. Our efforts to adapt European Education Area, starting Bologna Declaration, be supported by mobility activities as a part of process. In this context, activities be open for testing developing Programme in order to improve service quality processes. We also take necessary steps for Erasmus Without Paper, Online Learning Agreement Online IIA etc. under European Student Card Initative to digitize implementation processes become more efficient. content: How to Apply? Information E-mail After nomination is submitted you receive an information e-mail with web link to access your online application. title: Who can Apply
content: Who can Apply? If you wish to study at İstanbul Sabahattin Zaim University under the Erasmus+ Program, first check with your home university to see if it has an agreement with a particular faculty or department at İstanbul Sabahattin Zaim University. Academic staff from our university, project partners from abroad, teachers from Ministry of National Education attended multiplication meeting. The goal of project is to develop a digitally supported educational platform students aged 6-9 diagnosed with special learning disabilities. The multiplication meeting was conducted both face-to-face simultaneously online. The opening speeches were made by our Vice Rector, Prof. Dr. İbrahim GÜNEY. Following this, Mr. Özer TOPLU, coordinator on behalf of Provincial Directorate of National Education, provided information about project introduction results. Then, our university faculty member Dr. Nüket AFAT gave a presentation on target audience of project, children diagnosed with special learning disabilities. The last presentation before noon was given by Assoc. Prof. Dr. Aras BOZKURT from Anadolu University, who introduced digital platform prepared children with special learning disabilities. In afternoon sessions, Romanian team, one of project partners, presented on teacher training professional development. Following this, Bulgarian team gave a presentation titled "Self-Esteem Socialization" within scope of children with special needs. Finally, Portuguese team shared satisfaction surveys of students with special learning disabilities who tested digital platform during Transnational Project Meeting held in Portugal. After presenting certificates to project partners participants, multiplication meeting concluded. title: Residence Permit
content: Residence Permit Residence Permit تصريح الإقامة İkamet İzni Students enrolled in an academic program in Türkiye three months or longer are obliged to acquire a student per Law on Foreigners International Protection. title: University-Industry Collaboration Meeting Held at İZÜ
content: University-Industry Collaboration Meeting Held at İZÜ 26.02.2025 İZÜ Hosted executives from Istanbul Chamber of Industry (İSO) and prominent figures from business world to srengthen university-industry collaboration. Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University (İZÜ) hosted a significant meeting aimed at strengthening university-industry collaboration. The brakfast event was attented by Istanbul Chamber of Industry (İSO) Chairman Erdal Bahçıvan, İSO Assembly President Ender Yılmaz, and several board members from both İSO and Istanbul Chamber of Industry Foundation (İSOV), along with prominent business figuers. Also present at meeting were İlim Yayma Foundation President Bilal Erdoğan, foundation executives, İZÜ Board of Trustees Chairman Özkan Göksal, Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar, Vice Rector Prof. Dr. İbrahim Güney, Prof. Dr. İsmail Küçük, and Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener, as well as İZÜ Secratary General Dr. Fatih Hasdemir. The meeting emphasized that universities’ missions of producing scientific knowledge and training qualified professionals should align with needs of industry. Participants highlighted critical role of closer collaboration between industrial sector and universities in facilitating realization of innovative projects. It was also stated that meeting laid groundwork for new partnerships that will further strengthen interaction between industry and academia.

title: “İZÜ Sports Assembly” Held Its First Meeting
content: “İZÜ Sports Assembly” Held Its First Meeting 19.03.2025 Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University held first meeting of its Sports Assembly, which was established to encourage student participation in sports management. During meeting, attended by sports ambassadors, students’ requests, university’s current sports activities, and new projects were discussed. Following first meeting, assembly is expected to begin active work, and sports ambassadors are anticipated to represent student from their departments, making sports activities more effective. The İZÜ Sports Assembly provides students with opportunity to directly contribute to decision-making process in sports and to shape university’s sports culture together.

title: The İZÜ Family Came Together for Iftar
content: The İZÜ Family Came Together for Iftar 26.03.2025 In our iftar event organized to share the blessings and unity of the month of Ramadan, our academic and administrative staff, along with their valuable families, came together. Our Board Trustees Chairman Özkan Göksal, Board of Trustees Member Bekir Sakıb Şahinoğlu, Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar, Vice Rectors Prof. Dr. İsmail Küçük, Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener, and Prof. Dr. İbrahim Güney, Secretary General Dr. Fatih Hasdemir, along with TÜBA President Prof. Dr. Muzaffer Şeker and council members whom we hosted today on our campus, participated in the program where we shared the spiritual atmosphere of the month of Ramadan together. What remains from this meaningful night are beautiful memories and valuable moments spent together. We look forward to gathering again around many more beautiful tables…

title: Academic Thesis Supervision Principals
content: ISTANBUL SABAHATTIN ZAIM UNIVERSITY GRADUATE EDUCATION INSTITUTE ACADEMIC THESIS SUPERVISION PRINCIPALS knowledge transfer research results in higher education are closely related to production of a Master's Doctorate thesis. In that sense, one of fundamental responsibilities of graduate student’s supervisors at a university is to guide properly students during research writing process, make output turn into a product. Supervision is to contribute not only to transfer of research results but also at same time to create an education modelling in name of supervisor-student relation. That is why in field, whether in masters or doctorate, creating a successful thesis, supervision is of crucial importance. Moreover, supervision is highly contributing both to education system professional personal development of owner of thesis. Thus, selection of supervision period is extremely important because with knowledge, experience, feedback, vision, supervisors help, becomes a pathfinder, a guide to students to search write a successful thesis. Regarding, it is vital to abide by principles about supervision below success of theses written in departments related to our institute. is primarily responsible being a pathfinder a guide in processes which are required a successful product by determining subject of thesis, conducting research, collecting analysing data, writing in accordance with Institute's writing rules. subject supervisor’s professional field be relevant. have enough competence to guide students research have enough knowledge of subject. put attention to students from beginning of consider student’s interests expectations. subject title be determined through a discussion between student, also by examining studies in Turkish Higher Education Council (YÖK) National Thesis Centre ( https://tez.yok.gov.tr/UlusalTezMerkezi/ ). subject title be short, precise, clear, understandable, different from other already done theses. title’s Turkish English versions be coherent. Translations be in an language, not Google translate. guide, lead, help with background of research subject. be transparent, consistent, fair, neutral in practices. be a guide helper to in grading, analysing, interpreting data gained through research. is responsible quality of content, discussion, results of thesis. spare enough time student, answer his/her questions or demands constructively, be a pathfinder, contribute to his/her personal development. respect student’s ideas, do empathy, lead up to expedite student’s personal competency development. check whether it is written according to Institute's writing rules or not. If not, then facilitate to correct in compliance with writing rules. guide students to make learning process easier. make students improve critical-analytical thinking skills. make students develop independent research competence, critical-analytical thinking competence, help to gain an intellectual perspective. be sure that has conformed to IZU Thesis Project Writing Rules in writing process of thesis. go over which gets in a defence process through IZU Thesis Project Writing Rules scientific ethical principles, send an e-mail to Graduate Education Institute at least 15 workdays afore from anticipated defence day final draft control determination of average plagiarism. guide about controlling unit's feedback if there is, ensure that requested corrections or plagiarisms are edited by student. be extremely careful that grade point average (GPA) is at least 2.5/4 before entering to defence especially in Graduate (Master). After acceptance of control unit, be in collaboration with head of department, relevant administrative staff, about official date, place, jury of defence. be sure that corrects minor post-defence corrections through approved final draft by control unit do final controls of successful in required legal process its graduation. If there occurs a defence extension, at least 15 workdays afore, resend to determine final structural control plagiarism ratio with Graduate Education Institute control unit after approval, specify official defence date. In some processes, know her/his condition feel that she/he is led by can communicate with him/her easily. Before delivering thesis, head of department approve by doing last supervision/should fill final control form submit form with to Institute. Whether a master or doctorate thesis, facilitate to read defence processes on web site cautiously before delivering theses. CLICK FOR MASTER'S / DOCTORAL THESIS DEFENSE PROCESSES.

title: About 2023-2024 Fall Semester Doctoral Qualifying Exam Schedule
content: About 2023-2024 Fall Semester Doctoral Qualifying Exam Schedule 17.10.2023 Students who ask to apply for doctoral qualifying exam to be held in fall semester of 2023-2024 academic year are required to fill out Doctoral Qualifying application form at https://kampus.izu.edu.tr/login between October 30th-November 3rd, 2023 . Doctoral Qualifying Exams will be held on a date to be determined by relevant Head of Departments in December 2023 . The exams will be held at our Halkalı campus. POINTS TO BE CONSIDERED 1- Students who have successfully completed their courses and seminar, have a weighted grade point average of at least 3.00 and above, and fulfill Foreign Language Proficiency can apply for doctoral qualifying exam. 2- Students admitted with a master's degree must take doctoral qualifying exam until end of fifth semester at latest in compliance with relevant regulations. 3- Students who ask to take Doctoral Qualifying Examination, must have a thesis supervisor and choose from “Doctoral Qualifying Examination” section at https://derskayit.izu.edu.tr/Login 4- Students who applied for Doctoral Qualifying Examination held in spring semester of 2022-2023 academic year and did not take exam or failed exam, are required to apply again on specified dates. Students who do not apply will be considered unsuccessful and will be disenrolled from University. 5- Please click here for post-exam procedures of students who are successful in doctoral qualifying exam.

title: Directive For the Acceptance of Scientific Articles as a Doctoral Thesis
content: Directive For Acceptance of Scientific Articles as a Doctoral Thesis T.R. ISTANBUL SABAHATTIN ZAIM UNIVERSITY DIRECTIVE FOR THE ACCEPTANCE OF SCIENTIFIC ARTICLES AS A DOCTORAL THESIS Goal Article 1 (1) This directive includes application procedures of publications to take place of doctoral dissertations for Ph. D. degree, as well as criteria of article published in one of following indexed categories such as SSCI, AHCI according to IZU regulation for Academic Appointment and Promotion. The directive also aims to encourage production of quality papers from doctorate dissertation with name of university and increase number of citations. Basics Article 2 (1) A doctoral student can submit at least three publications that s/he has prepared as a doctoral dissertation to be accepted instead of a doctoral dissertation . At least two of these publications in physical field and at least one in Social Sciences must have published in internationally recognized indexes such as SCI, SSCI, AHCI or have been accepted for publication (with a DOI number). These studies must be prepared during doctoral studies. (2) Dissertation study is expected to have a significant contribution to research and writing in publications. The contribution in publication in question must belong to student and student must be first author. (3) The name of dissertation supervisor can take place in publications as second author. (4) The publication (s) used in one dissertation cannot be used in another dissertation. (5) Dissertation Evaluation Committee decides on academic competence of three articles submitted instead of doctoral thesis. Application Article 4 (1) The student applies to Institute together with articles he/she has prepared and a letter from dissertation supervisor stating student's contribution to preparation and writing of articles. Operation Article 5 (1) This directive gets into effect when it is signed. Execution Article 6 (1) The provisions of this directive are executed by head of relevant department and director of Institute.

title: The 1st International Congress on the Science of Teaching and Learning Has Begun
content: The 1st International Congress on Science of Teaching Learning Has Begun 28.04.2025 The "1st International Congress on Science of Teaching Learning," organized by IZU Center for Development Research of Teaching Learning (IZU ÖGEM), has begun at Abdullah Tivnikli Conference Hall. The congress was attended by IZU Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar, Vice Rectors Prof. Dr. İbrahim Güney Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener, Faculty of Education Vice Dean ÖGEM Director Assoc. Prof. Dr. Kâmil Arif Kırkıç, as well as academics from both domestic international institutions. In his opening speech, IZU Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar drew attention to risks of artificial intelligence digitalization, emphasizing need to approach learning processes from multiple perspectives. Rector Acar stated: "Along with different technologies, risks have also emerged regarding personal development. With advent of artificial intelligence, we can no longer be sure to what extent scientific research is genuinely conducted by researchers themselves. Especially worldwide, youth unemployment rates are at least twice as high as adult unemployment rates. Smart technologies will also accompany our mental potential. It may become even harder to find jobs. Therefore, continuing our work with current methods in field of education does not seem feasible. Especially in this digital age, we must consider every possibility when it comes to learning." THE CONGRESS WILL CONTINUE ONLINE OVER THE WEEKEND The first speaker of day, Prof. Dr. Münevver Çetin, highlighted effects of digital transformation in higher education in her presentation titled "Digital Ecosystem in Higher Education: The Changing Role of Academics New Generation Teaching Methods." Prof. Dr. Tuncay Dilci, in his talk on "Problematic Use of Digital Objects," shared insights into conscious use of digital tools. Prof. Dr. Selçuk Beşir Demir, in his presentation titled "Mistakes Solution Suggestions in Publishing Writing Process in SSCI-SCI Journals," shed light on academic publishing process. In parallel sessions held simultaneously, participants from various universities presented academic studies related to teaching learning processes. The congress will continue with online sessions on April 19–20.

title: The Music Teacher Training School Commemorated at İZÜ on Its 100th Anniversary
content: Teacher Training School Commemorated at İZÜ on Its 100th Anniversary 05.05.2025 Teacher Training School Commemorated at İZÜ on Its 100th Anniversary Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University (İZÜ) commemorated centennial anniversary of Musiki Muallim Mektebi one of foundational institutions of Turkish music education through organization of “1st National Workshop on Teacher Training School in Its 100th Year.” Held at Nizamülmülk Conference Hall, event brought together prominent academics, musicians, music educators. workshop’s honorary committee included İZÜ Rector Ahmet Cevat Acar, Vice Rectors İbrahim Güney, İsmail Küçük, Erhan İçener. executive committee was chaired by Süleyman Erguner. Among notable names on honorary board were Ali Uçan, Honorary President of Educators’ Association (MÜZED), Amir Ateş, President of Üsküdar Society. Acar: Universities Have a Vital Role in Preservation of Turkish Joining event live from Indonesia, İZÜ Rector Ahmet Cevat Acar emphasized important role that universities play in preserving developing Turkish music. He stated: “Especially in realm of Turkish music its subfields, there are many responsibilities that fall to us as universities. Musiki Muallim Mektebi began its activities as a pioneering institution in Republican era. As a university, we will continue to support contribute to this legacy.” Güney: Our University Places Great Importance on Arts Speaking at opening of workshop, Vice Rector Dean of Faculty of Education İbrahim Güney, a member of honorary board, referenced university’s history its decision four years ago to establish a Department of Music. He noted: “This year, we are pleased to be graduating our first cohort. As a university, we place great emphasis on education in arts. Our music department is a vital part of this vision.” Erguner: Turkish Carries a 3,000-Year-Old Cultural Heritage Süleyman Erguner, Chair of Department of Fine Arts Education Head of Education Division at İZÜ, emphasized significance of Musiki Muallim Mektebi . Stressing that music teaching is not merely a profession but also a means of cultural transmission, he remarked: “Music teachers help reveal potential within our children. Not every child will become a musician, but every child can develop a love appreciation for music. This is immensely valuable for progress of society. Turkish music carries legacy of a cultural tradition dating back 3,000 years encompassing musical heritage of Huns, Göktürks, Seljuks, Ottomans, Republic of Türkiye.” Nationwide Academic Participation organizing committee included respected scholars from various institutions: İbrahim Güney Süleyman Erguner (İZÜ), Ali Uçan (MÜZED), Cenk Güray (Hacettepe University), Erhan Özden (Ankara University of Fine Arts), Evren Bilge Kutlay (İZÜ), Gözde Çolakoğlu Sarı (Istanbul Technical University), Hakan Cevher, Mustafa Uslu (Marmara University), Uğur Alpagut (MÜZED), Uğur Türkmen (Çanakkale Onsekiz Mart University), Lecturer artist Süleyman Şenel (ITU), Bedirhan Büyükduman (İZÜ), who also served as vice-chair of organizing committee. Seven Thematic Sessions on Education workshop consisted of seven sessions addressing topics such as historical development of music education, its current status, instrumental training, teacher preparation process, curriculum challenges. A session comparing music education programs in Türkiye to those abroad highlighted issues of merit, curriculum design, instructional materials. Key current topics such as national entrance exam threshold (TYT) impact of National Education Academy on student quotas were discussed in fourth session. fifth session focused on role quality of instrumental instruction in teacher training. final session provided a comprehensive evaluation of all previous discussions outlined framework for final report. Scientific Committee Ensured Academic Rigor scientific committee, comprising leading scholars such as İbrahim Güney, Süleyman Erguner, Evren Bilge Kutlay, Bedirhan Büyükduman (İZÜ), Gözde Çolakoğlu Sarı Lecturer Süleyman Şenel (ITU), Ali Uçan Uğur Alpagut (MÜZED), Erhan Özden (Ankara University of Fine Arts), Cenk Güray (Hacettepe University), Mustafa Uslu (Marmara University), Uğur Türkmen (Çanakkale Onsekiz Mart University), Hakan Cevher, played a key role in ensuring academic depth interdisciplinary breadth of event. To enrich spiritual atmosphere of workshop, İZÜ Choir performed all ten stanzas of Turkish National Anthem live, accompanied by original composition by Osman Zeki Üngör.

title: The Parliament Simulation Was Just Like the Real Thing
content: The Parliament Simulation Was Just Like Real Thing 07.05.2025 Parliament Simulation at Zaim Was Just Like Real Thing Organized by our Law Club, “Zaim Parliament Simulation” was held in Nizamülmülk Conference Hall. The event brought together eager to experience legislative processes of Grand National Assembly of Türkiye. During program, took on role of members of parliament, proposing bills engaging with legislative process. Held at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University, simulation provided participants with a parliament experience that felt incredibly real. Among attendees were AK Party Istanbul Deputy Av. Nurettin Alan, President of Bar Association No. 2 Av. Yasin Şamlı, IZU Vice Rector Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener, IZU Faculty of Law Vice Dean Dr. Halit Serhan Ercivelek, along with many professionals from fields of law, academia, politics. ALAN: PARLIAMENT IS THE CENTER OF CURRENT POLITICS In his opening speech, AK Party Istanbul Deputy Av. Nurettin Alan stated that should become "legal engineers" who actively shape legislation. He continued: “Simulations like these don’t just help you learn existing laws they help you become individuals who discuss, improve, guide future legislation. Parliament is also center of current politics. Everything that concerns society is discussed there. In fact, many of headlines you see in news come from parliament. Historically, we are children of a glorious civilization. However, this civilization has recently been obscured. You, youth, are ones who will blow truth into ashes reignite its fire.” ŞAMLI: LAW IS NOT JUST LEGISLATION IT IS JUSTICE Bar President Av. Yasin Şamlı recalled past changes in Turkish Penal Code: “At one point, even peaceful protests were tried as attempts to overthrow constitutional order. Even high school demanding right to education were prosecuted with potential death sentences. It wasn’t easy to correct these injustices. That’s why understanding essence of law focusing on justice is so crucial.” Şamlı emphasized that law should not be seen as limited to written rules: “A regulation can be legal but still unfair. Law, at its core, is what is just. Law is a scale.” İÇENER: WE MUST RAISE INDIVIDUALS WHO PRODUCE KNOWLEDGE, NOT JUST CONSUME IT IZU Vice Rector Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener highlighted value of simulation-based learning: “These simulations allow to learn not only through theory but also through role-playing, position-taking, direct debate. When actively engage, learning becomes much more lasting.” He added, “This level of interest gives me hope. Today’s youth are no longer satisfied with just studying they question ideologies, world systems, values of civilization. One foot must stay rooted in our land, other must explore world. That’s how a global perspective is formed. Though AI, social media, rapid information tools save time, they can weaken mental depth. We expect our to be not just consumers of knowledge, but also its producers.” ERCİVELEK: OUR PARLIAMENTARY TRADITION GOES BACK TO CENTRAL ASIA Dr. Halit Serhan Ercivelek, Vice Dean of IZU Faculty of Law, spoke on historical roots of parliament concept: “When we talk about parliament, we usually refer to Western examples. But long before that, in Turkish states of Central Asia, there was a tradition of kurultay assemblies that convened twice a year to elect rulers decide on wars. This is a value rooted in our cultural memory. Parliament is not just an institution it represents collective thinking decision-making.” STUDENTS EXPERIENCED THE LEGISLATIVE PROCESS Chaired by Güzide Arslan, a third-year Law student president of Law Club, Zaim Parliament Simulation included workshops, party meetings, committee discussions, general assembly sessions. These activities allowed to gain a deeper understanding of legislative processes. The event helped young participants develop skills in expression, debate, critical thinking on social issues.

title: The “Golden Age of Islamic Civilization” Discussed at IZU
content: The “Golden Age of Islamic Civilization” Discussed at IZU 07.05.2025 The “Golden Age of Islamic Civilization” Discussed at IZU The "Andalusian Panel," jointly organized by IZU History Club, Mişkatla Geçerken Student Community, Halil İnalcık Center for Historical Social Studies, was held at Nizamülmülk Conference Hall. The panel was attended by IZU Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar, Prof. Dr. Ahmet Ağırakça, Assoc. Prof. Dr. Cumhur Ersin Adıgüzel, as well as academics students. The event began with a recitation from Qur'an, followed by an opening speech from Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar. In his remarks, he drew attention to challenges currently faced by Muslim societies, using historical legacy of Al-Andalus as a point of reflection. Prof. Dr. Acar stated: “The Islamic state that existed in Andalusia for 800 years played a vital role not only in fields of science culture but also in shaping Western civilization. However, today, traces of this cultural heritage have largely disappeared from Andalusian lands. This tragic ending should serve as a lesson. The current approach of Western world toward Muslim communities in both Turkey Europe is not much different from historical policies toward Andalusia. The genocide in Bosnia attempts to reshape Islam in Albania are examples of this. We must view our differences as strengths unite around shared values. History should be a source of insight, painful experiences of past must not be forgotten. Andalusia is not just a memory of past; it is a legacy that reminds us of our responsibilities for future.” SPEECHES BY AĞIRAKÇA AND ADIGÜZEL Prof. Dr. Ahmet Ağırakça, in his presentation titled “Physicians of Al-Andalus,” discussed contributions of Andalusian doctors to both Islamic world Western medicine. Assoc. Prof. Dr. Cumhur Ersin Adıgüzel, in his talk titled “Al-Andalus as a Cradle of Islamic Civilization,” examined political, cultural, intellectual structure of Andalusia.

He said: “Entrepreneurship is not just about producing goods services, but also about taking risks to add value to society. The entrepreneurs awarded here today not only shape business world but also contribute to our country’s economic independence. Entrepreneurs carry income, livelihood, future of everyone they employ on their shoulders. Supporting them is not just an economic, but also a moral responsibility. Entrepreneurship is key to a strong future.” AWARDS WERE PRESENTED TO REPRESENTATIVES FROM VARIOUS SECTORS INCLUDING BUSINESS, SPORTS, ART, AND TECHNOLOGY At Golden Inspiration Awards, inspiring figures from many fields such as business, media, sports, art were honored. title: IZU at the 10th EURIE Summit
content: IZU at 10th EURIE Summit 16.04.2025 The 10th EURIE Eurasia Higher Education Summit, organized by Eurasian Universities Union, commenced at Istanbul Lütfi Kırdar International Convention Exhibition Center. Bringing together universities, academics, Industry representetiv from around world, summit hosted over 2,000 participant from 65 countries. The opening ceremony of program was attended by Prof. Dr. Erol Özvar, President of Council of Higher Education; Davut Gül, Governor of Istanbul; Dr. Zambry Abdul Kadir, Minister of Higher Education of Malaysia; Dr. Fanta Aw, CEO of North American Association of International Educators (NAFSA); Martin Hope, Global Director of British Council; Şekib Avdagiç, Chairman of Service Exporters Association Istanbul Chamber of Commerce; Mustafa Gültepe, President of Turkish Exporters Assembly. Özvar: Universities Must Engage in International Collaboration Speaking at opening of summit, President of Council of Higher Education (YÖK), Prof. Dr. Erol Özvar, stated that EURIE has become a vital platform not only at regional level but also on a global scale for fostering dialogue, partnerships, sustainable relations among higher education institutions. Emphasizing that education builds strong bridges between countries, Prof. Özvar remarked: "Today, universities are no longer confined to delivering academic knowledge alone—they are increasingly confronted with expanded roles responsibilities, including digital transformation international collaboration." IZU Took Its Place at Summit Representing Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University, Office of International Students Relations participated in summit, where participants exchanged insights on current developments in field of international higher education. On behalf of our university, meetings were held with institutions from various countries to explore opportunities for academic collaboration student exchange programs.

Kaya said, "The Crescent is a longstanding institution that has always stood by society. Especially in recent years, it has increased its efforts to stand by both oppressed and victims. title: Andalusian Hajj Pilgrims: "We Want to Cross the Bosphorus on Horseback and Stroll in Sultanahmet"
content: Andalusian Hajj Pilgrims: "We Want to Cross Bosphorus on Horseback Stroll in Sultanahmet" 27.02.2025 Four Andalusian Muslims, traveling an 8,000-k,lometer rout to mecca on horseback, have arrived in İstanbul. Hosted by İZÜ, Abdullah Rafael Hernandez Mancha, Abdelqader Harkassi Aidi, Tarek Rodriguez Fernandez, Bouchaib Jadil shared inspiring journey with İZÜ students. They plan to spend Ramadan in İstanbul and, if possible, cross bridge connecting two continents on horseback, visit Hagia Sophia, stroll through Sultanahmet. During stop in İstanbul Sabahattin Zaim University (İZU), pilgrims met with students in an event attended by Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar Vice Rector Prof. Dr. İsmail Küçük. İZÜ’s International Students Relations Coordinator, İlhan Yalım, who had followed pilgrims for a month, expressed honor of hosting them in İstanbul. Yalım stated, “Istanbul is significant stop on journey.” KOUNOĞLU. ISTANBUL REMAİNS AN IMPORTANT STOP FOR PILGRIMS Prof. Dr. Hüseyin Hüsnü Koyunoğlu from İZÜ emphasized Istanbul’s historical significance in pilgrimage journeys, mentioning that pilgrims from regions like Uzbekistan India used to stop in Istanbul for Surre processions. Istanbul Historically a host for pilgrims, continues to be a central stop for those on way on Mecca, known as ‘Dersaadet’ (Gate of Blessing). ACAR: THE LEGACY OF ANDALUSIAN CIVILIZATION IS STILL PRESENT İZU Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmed Cevat Acar expressed his pleasure in hosting Andalusian Muslims Highlighted continuing legacy of Andalusian civilization. He noted signitificance of pilgrimage journey, stating that legacy of a long- gone civilization still influences present, espacially through Spain’s stance on current global issues like Palestinian situation. 35 YEARS OF DREAMİNG OF THE PILGRLMAGE Dr. Abdullah Rafael Hernandez Mancha shared his 35-year- long dream of making pilgrimage on horseback, a tradation he felt connected to through his study of Quran. He decided to undertake journey after a successful geography exam, converting to Islam in process. After retiring from Seville University, he embarked on this journey with fellow pilgrims Abdelqader Harkassi Aidi, Tarek Rodriguez Fernandez, Bouchaib Jadil, starting from Spain four months ago. JOURNEY THROUGH EUROPE INSTEAD OF NORTH AFRICA Mancha explained that they initially planned to travel via North Africa but shifted to Europe due to road issues in Morocco Algeria. Their journey through Italy, Bosnia, other countries has been filled with memorable experiences, including meeting an Italian nationalist who eventually softened his stance on Islam. “OUR CLOTHES ARE WITNESSES TO OUR JOURNEY” The pilgrims set off with limited funds, but received support from local Muslims along way. Mancha highlighted significance of worn clothes, which have become symbols of journey. He also expressed plans to spend Ramadan in Istanbul, exploring city on horseback visiting iconic sites like Hagia Sophia Sultanahmet. “WE CANT BRING OUR HORSES BACK TO SPAIN” Mancha revealed that while they had trained extensively for journey, they won’t be able to bring horses back to Spain due to European Union regulations. After completing pilgrimage, they will fly back to Spain, leaving horses behind. AIDI: WHO ELSE BUT CRAZY SPANIARDS? Abdelqader Harkassi Aidi, a member of team, humorously likened journey to Don Quixote's adventures. He shared how journey, though tough, has been guided by Allah, he felt honored to be part of it. JADIL JOINS THE TEAM Bouchaib Jadil, who joined group while working at Dr. Mancha’s house, spoke about his role in logistics how journey has been most significant experience of his life.

title: The President of YTB, Abdullah Eren, Met with İZÜ students
content: The President of YTB, Abdullah Eren, Met with İZÜ students 03.03.2025 In event titled “YTB Its Activities”,organized by İZÜ Politics Club, president of presidency for Turks Abroad Related Communities (YTB), Abdullah Eren, met with students. The event, held at Nizamüimülk Conference Hall of Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University, was attended by Rector of İZÜ, Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar, Vice Rectors Prof. Dr. İbrahim Güney Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener, as well as Secretary General of İZÜ, Dr. Fatih Hasdemir, along with academicians a large number of students. ACAR: TURKEY RANKS AMONG THE TOP 10 COUNTRIES HOSTING INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS In his opening speech, İZÜ Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar emphasized in increasing significance of international relations academic mobility in a globlizing world. Noting that Turkey has achieved a prominent position in terms of number of international students, Rector Acar stated: “Today, Turkey is among top 10 countries hosting international students. It is of great importance for Turkey to harness it is potential in this field, especially in regions we refer to as our ‘heartland’, among others. In this regard, Presidency for Turks Abroad related Communities plays a crucial role.” EREN: TURKEY IS NOW MORE ACTIVE IN INTERNATIONAL ISSUES The speaker of program, Abdullah Eren, President of Presidency for Turks Abroad Related Communities (YTB), began by providing information about YTB. Eren described Turkey’s rise in foreign policy over past 20 years with following words: “The Presidency for Turks Abroad Related Communities (YTB) was established in 2010. The establishment of this institution is not a coincidence. There is a concept called state intelligence; it refers to a structue that acts according to circumstances makes long-terms plans. Over last 20 years, Turkey has experienced a significant paradigm shift in its foreign policy. Now, Turkey follows a policy that aims to play a more active role in international issues to have a say in global events.”

title: Senior Bureaucrats Meet with IZU Students
content: Senior Bureaucrats Meet with IZU Students 05.03.2025 The “Career Chat with Managers” program was held at IZU. Prof. Dr. Selim Çapar, President of AREM of Ministry of Interior of Republic of Turkey, saffet Arıkan Bedük, President of Governors’ Association, met with students. The event focused on career paths in fields of management bureaucracy. The “Career Chat with Managers” program, organized by Political Science Club of Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University, brought together students interested in management bureaucrary with experienced professionals. The seminar featured Prof. Dr. Selim Çapar, President of AREM at Ministry of Interior of Republic of Turkey, Saffet Arıkan Bedük, President of Governors’ Association, as speakers. Prior to program, bureaucrats who visited our university gathered at our campus, hosted by IZU Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar Vice Rector Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener. After a breakfast discussion on education bureaucracy, seminar moved to Seminar Hall 2 for “Career Chat with Managers” session. “SERVING THE STATE AND THE NATION IS OUR GREATEST IDEAL” In his opening speech, Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener, Vice Rector of IZU, emphasized that bureaucracy is a critical field for students of public administration political science, saying: “Most of you are young. Among us are students from Department of political Science Faculty of law. As a graduate of International Relations Department, I would like to say that when we started university, we generally had two career paths in mind. For students of Political Science Public Administration, one of most preferred career paths was becoming a district governor or governor, while for students of International Relations, Ministry of Foreign Affairs was typically most prominent. In recent years, National Intelligence Organization (MİT) has also become an area of interest for students. Our friends in Faculty of Law naturally tend to pursue careers in judgeship public prosectuion. When we were students, serving state nation was our greatest ideal. Listening to our guests today benefiting from their experiences will be a valuable gain for all of you.” “THE GOVERNORSHIP AND DISTRICT GOVERNORSHIP ARE CALLING PROFESSIONS” After opening speech, one of program’s guests, Saffet Arıkan Bedük, President of Governors’ Association, gave a speech titled “A Career from Local Government to Governorship." Bedük emphasized that public administration is a field that requires responsibility, stating: "The Turkish nation has an important heritage with its deep history rich culture. At core of this heritage are management approach strong leaders. The elements that ensure peace, security, welfare of people are well-functioning management systems. The opportunities provided by our universities state are not limited to Turkey alone. By following developments in technology, science, other areas worldwide bringing them to our country, we also bear a great responsibility. The most important structure that offers us these opportunities is state. Governorship district governorship are calling professions." Prof. Dr. Selim Çapar, President of AREM at Ministry of Interior of Republic of Turkey, presented a detailed analysis in his speech titled "From District Governorship to Senior Bureaucracy." He provided detailed insights on career planning in state administration process of rising in bureaucracy. Prof. Çapar also shared a roadmap for IZU students, outlining steps they should follow. The event, which allowed students to get a closer look at career opportunities in public administration, concluded with a Q&A session.

title: About 2024-2025 Spring Semester Doctoral Qualifying Exam Schedule
content: About 2024-2025 Spring Semester Doctoral Qualifying Exam Schedule 10.03.2025 Students who are willing to apply for PhD qualifying exam to be held in spring semester of 2024-2025 academic year are required to fill out PhD Qualifying application form at https://kampus.izu.edu.tr/login between March 10-14, 2025 . PhD Qualifying Exams will be held on a date to be determined by relevant Head of Departments in June 2025 . The exams will be held at our Halkalı campus. Students who do not apply will be considered unsuccessful and will be disenrolled from University. 5- Please click here for post-exam procedures of students who are successful in PhD qualifying exam.

title: A Visit to Our University by the IHH search and Rescue Team
content: A Visit to Our University by IHH search Rescue Team 19.03.2025 Orhan parlak, Head of search Rescue Training Unit of Humanitarian Relief Foundation (İHH), visited Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University. During visit, collaboration support processes for search rescue teams planned to be established at our university were discussed. In meeting hosted by Vice Rector Prof. Dr. İbrahim Güney, Dean of Faculty of Sports Sciences Prof. Dr. Mustafa Zahit Serarslan, Assistant Dean Dr.Abdüsselam Köse, necessary steps for rapid effective intervention in disasters were evaluated. Discussions were held on potential collaboratins regarding training, equipment procurement, field applications required to establish a search rescue team within university. İHH search Rescue officials expressed their readiness to provide support in raising disaster awareness preparing for possible emergency situations.

title: International Academic Meeting at İZÜ
content: International Academic Meeting at İZÜ 19.03.2025 İZÜ hosted a delegation from Al Marisah Madani University in Indonesia. The delegation, under the guidance of the Dean of the Faculty of Health Sciences, Prof. Dr. Ayşe Nefise Bahçecik, visited İZÜ Vice Rector Prof. Dr. İsmail Küçük. During the visit, academic collaborations, joint projects, and educational opportunities were discussed, university laboratories were toured, and academic meetings were held. Additionally, Dr. Andi Nur Aisyah gave a lecure on “Anti-Inflammatory Treatment in Cancer Patients” to students of the Faculty of Health Sciences at İZÜ. An international agreement was signed with Al Marisah Madani University in Indonesia on September 13, 2023. This visit marked an important step in implementing the agreement, developing international cooperation, and strengthening cultural ties.

title: İZÜ Signs Memorandum of Understanding with American Islamic College
content: İZÜ Signs Memorandum of Understanding with American Islamic College 29.01.2025 January 23, 2025 Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University (İZÜ) hosted representatives from American Islamic College as part of its international academic collaboration efforts. The delegation was welcomed by İZÜ Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar and Vice Rector Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener . The visit included discussions on İZÜ’s academic programs and institutional vision, with the participation of American Islamic College President Dr. Timothy J. Gianotti and Prof. Dr. Abdullah Yavaş from the University of Wisconsin-Madison . During the meetings, which were also attended by İZÜ academics, a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) was signed between İZÜ and American Islamic College . The agreement outlines mutual visits, joint research projects, and the organization of collaborative seminars and conferences , strengthening academic ties between the institutions.

title: Dr. Fatih Hasdemir has started his duties as the Secretary General at IZÜ
content: Dr. Fatih Hasdemir has started his duties as Secretary General at IZÜ 05.02.2025 03.02.2025 On his first day at IZÜ, Dr. Hasdemir met with administrators of university's administrative units. Our Rector, Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar, Vice Rector, Prof. Dr. İsmail Küçük, wished him success in his new role. Born in 1965 in Erzurum, Dr. Hasdemir completed his undergraduate education in Department of Economics at Faculty of Economics Administrative Sciences, Uludağ University (1987). He pursued his graduate doctoral studies in United Kingdom. Between 1995 2002, Dr. Hasdemir served as a faculty member Assistant Dean at Department of Economics, Faculty of Economics Administrative Sciences, Balıkesir University. He worked at Energy Market Regulatory Authority Prime Ministry Privatization Administration. From 2005 to 2011, Dr. Hasdemir served as President of National Agency. He then served as Deputy Undersecretary of Ministry for EU Affairs from 2011 to 2013, as Deputy Permanent Representative of Turkey to EU from 2013 to 2016. Between 2016 2020, he worked as Deputy Undersecretary of Ministry of Development. Most recently, Dr. Hasdemir served as Secretary General of Fatih Sultan Mehmet Foundation University from 2020 to 2024. As of today, he has assumed role of Secretary General at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University.

title: IZU Doctoral Programs Academic Training Scholarship
content: IZU Doctoral Programs Academic Training Scholarship 26.07.2024 IZU Doctoral Programs Academic Training Scholarship Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University Will provide Academic Training Scholarships to 15 doctoral students. Application Requirements - Apply for a Doctoral Program at IZU, - Not be employed in any job provide documentation for it, - Be willing to participate full-time in university's educational, teaching, research activities, - Have a minimum score of 80 from ALES, 156 from GRE, or 590 from GMAT. Foreign students are not required to have ALES, GRE, or GMAT scores; however, if they have GRE or GMAT scores, these will be converted to ALES scores for evaluation, - Have a minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.00 out of 4.00 a minimum graduate GPA of 3.50 out of 4.00, - For programs in Turkish, candidate must have a minimum score of 70 from YDS/YÖKDİL or an equivalent international foreign language score accepted by ÖSYM in relevant foreign language. For programs conducted partially or entirely in a foreign language, candidate must have a minimum score of 80 from YDS/YÖKDİL or an equivalent international foreign language score accepted by ÖSYM in relevant foreign language. title: IZU Successfully Completed ISO 27001 Audit
content: IZU Successfully Completed ISO 27001 Audit 26.07.2024 IZU Successfully Completed ISO 27001 Information Security Management System Audit IZU has successfully completed ISO 27001 Information Security Management System audit. This important process has once again confirmed compliance of information security management system with standards. IZU Vice Rector Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener highlighted importance of ISO 27001 audit, stating, "Such efforts allow us to maintain high standards of information security within institution and enable us to improve ourselves. Adhering to standards like ISO 27001 strengthens culture of information security and contributes to institutional development." During audit process, Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University's information security procedures, risk management, and data protection policies were thoroughly examined. The results obtained once again demonstrated high standards of university in this area. Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener emphasized importance university places on such efforts and expressed his gratitude to entire team for their contribution to this success. In 2018, university was awarded ISO 27001 Information Security Management System Certificate and continues to work with goal of continuous development and improvement in field of information security, undergoing internal and external audits every year. Maintaining continuity of ISO 27001 Information Security Management System certificate is of great importance as a testament to commitment in this direction.
