title: IZU's 10th Graduation Ceremony Held with Great Enthusiasm
content: IZU's 10th Graduation Ceremony Held with Great Enthusiasm 27.07.2024 Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University held its 2023-2024 academic year graduation ceremony. The ceremony, held at IZU Halkalı central campus, saw attendance of Minister of Trade Prof. Dr. Ömer Bolat, Chairman of Board of Trustees of İlim Yayma Foundation Necmeddin Bilal Erdoğan, Chairman of Board of Trustees of Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University Özkan Göksal, Rector of Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar, Vice Rectors Prof. Dr. İbrahim Güney, Prof. Dr. İsmail Küçük, Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener, along with academics administrative staff. The unforgettable event at IZU Stadium began with Turkish National Anthem a moment of silence, followed by a recitation from Quran after families graduating students had taken their seats. In his opening speech, IZU Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar addressed eager graduates their families, emphasizing importance of being a part of IZU its educational quality. Acar offered advice for future highlighted significance of day, saying, "I thank our esteemed professors families who have contributed to success of our students. I congratulate our dear graduates on their graduation. May your path be clear your successes continuous." Chairman of Board of Trustees, Özkan Göksal, began his speech by congratulating graduates. He noted rise of İlim Yayma Foundation in fields of science education, stating, "Our university, established 14 years ago, has made most of this period. We will continue to elevate quality of our university, which is among best educational institutions in our country." Necmeddin Bilal Erdoğan, Chairman of Board of Trustees of İlim Yayma Foundation, shared his excitement pride, saying, "As İlim Yayma Foundation, we will continue to work to grow our cornerstone university, which has been developing excellent individuals for over 70 years. I wish all our students success." Minister of Trade Prof. Dr. Ömer Bolat, who graced ceremony with his presence, also inspired graduates with his remarks. Bolat said, "As a former academician at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University, seeing our graduates today makes me proud." Following speeches, gifts were presented to dignitaries. After gift presentations photo sessions, top-ranking students took stage. Gifts were given to top students of each department, plaques were awarded to those who ranked highest, doubling joy. The moments when diplomas were awarded were truly memorable. As each department was called to stage one by one, families experienced a separate sense of pride. As countdown for graduation celebration began, entire hall held its breath. The graduation joy reached its peak when students tossed their caps into air. On this unforgettable day, graduates experienced excitement of stepping into their new lives, while their families friends shared in their happiness. Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University once again emphasized its belief in future successes of its graduates by celebrating their achievements.

title: The Importance of Organ Donation Discussed at İZÜ
content: The Importance of Organ Donation Discussed at İZÜ 20.11.2024 The İZÜ Faculty of Health Sciences, Department of Nursing, organized an "Organ Donation Seminar" as part of Organ Donation Week. The program featured representatives from Mehmet Akif Ersoy Thoracic, Cardiovascular Surgery Training Research Hospital as speakers. They provided attendees with information on importance of organ donation, donation process, raising public awareness. The "Organ Donation Seminar," organized by Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University Faculty of Health Sciences, Department of Nursing, was held in Seminar Room 2. The event was attended by Faculty Dean, Prof. Dr. Ayşe Nefise Bahçecik, representatives from Ministry of Health's Istanbul Mehmet Akif Ersoy Thoracic Cardiovascular Surgery Training Research Hospital, who provided attendees with comprehensive information. In her opening speech, Assoc. Prof. Dr. Zülfünaz Özer emphasized life-saving role of organ donation need to increase public awareness on matter. Özer stated, "Organ donation is one of most sacred ways for a person who has passed away to give life to another. One person's decision can change dozens of lives rekindle hope." Organ Transplant Coordinators from Mehmet Akif Ersoy Hospital, Specialist Nurse Gamze Ataman Yıldız Nurse Sıdık Biricik, shared insights on organ donation transplantation processes. Yıldız explained legal aspects of organ donation, transplantation process, requirements for donation, brain death, donor care. She highlighted that Turkey is a global leader, particularly in live donor donations. As part of event, a booth set up by Ministry of Health allowed university students to fill out forms to become organ donors.

title: The Great Plane Tree of Turkish Music Commemorated at İZÜ on the 50th Anniversary of His Passing
content: The Great Plane Tree of Turkish Music Commemorated at İZÜ on 50th Anniversary of His Passing 27.11.2024 The "Pole of Ney" Ulvi Erguner was commemorated at İZÜ on 50th anniversary of his passing. The program, titled "The Ney Virtuoso Ulvi Erguner: Transcending Time with His Sound Passion," featured a concert by his son, ney virtuoso İZÜ faculty member Süleyman Erguner, alongside vocal instrumental artists. The event, which showcased Erguner family compositions spanning generations, was highlighted by touching memories from Korean War. Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University held a program titled "The Ney Virtuoso Ulvi Erguner: Transcending Time with His Sound Passion," honoring life contributions of Ulvi Erguner, known as “Kutb-i Nâyi” (Pole of Ney Virtuosos). Led by Süleyman Erguner, event included stories a commemorative concert. In his opening speech, İZÜ Rector Ahmet Cevat Acar highlighted importance of preserving Turkish music amidst rise of foreign influences emphasized İZÜ’s efforts to support it through education research. THE ERGUNER FAMILY'S MUSICAL LEGACY At an event attended by İZÜ Vice Rectors İbrahim Güney Erhan İçener, İZÜ faculty member ney virtuoso Süleyman Erguner reflected on lasting influence of his father, Ulvi Erguner, grandfather, Süleyman Erguner. “There is an Erguner school in ney, passed down through generations,” he said. “My father, Ulvi Erguner, was a pioneer, bringing Sufi music to radio paving way for others. A follower of Mevlana’s teachings, he expanded Sufi music ney tradition both on stage in academia.” A MEMORY FROM THE KOREAN WAR: THE ‘GAZI NEY’ Süleyman Erguner shared a moving story from his father Ulvi Erguner’s time during Korean War. He recounted how his father played ney during a month-long sea voyage to accompany Turkish soldiers, offering them comfort amid hardships of war homesickness. “The ney’s sound became a source of solace morale for troops throughout journey,” he said. A ney damaged in an explosion during war became known in music circles as ‘gazi ney’ (veteran ney), which Erguner later repaired. Years later, he had honor of playing it again at a special invitation from Korea. The event continued with a concert featuring compositions from Erguner family select works of Turkish music. Süleyman Erguner was accompanied by Mehmet Öncel, TRT vocalist Furkan Biçer, others, offering music lovers a journey through Turkish music's rich heritage. Ulvi Erguner’s legacy provided an emotional cultural experience for all in attendance.

title: The “BaşArı Kadın” Program Shined a Light on Women's Entrepreneurship
content: The “BaşArı Kadın” Program Shined a Light on Women's Entrepreneurship 30.10.2024 The “BaşArı Kadın” program, organized by Entrepreneurship Club, was held in Museum Hall with participation of our Rector, Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar. The event focused on role of women in business world featured speakers from IZU, including Dr. Tuğçenur Ekinci Furtana, Lecturer in International Trade Finance Department, SKS Department Head Hülya Şekerci. Also speaking were Entrepreneur Kübra Orakçıoğlu Kazan, GZT Editor Kevser Erbay, Lokma Digital Publishing Director Beyza Nur Şahin. The “BaşArı Kadın” program, organized by IZU’s Entrepreneurship Club, took place with attendance of our Rector, Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar. The event included notable speakers in women’s entrepreneurship, such as IZU’s International Trade Finance Lecturer Dr. Tuğçenur Ekinci Furtana SKS Department Head Hülya Şekerci. In his opening remarks, Rector Acar highlighted growing presence of women in business world, emphasizing importance of female entrepreneurs female workforce in Turkey’s economy. He stated, “Today, women play a more active role in business world. Most of our university students are women. With increased competition, Turkish economy remains dependent on external sources. We don’t have oil, so women play a vital role in revealing innovative spirit of Turkey's economy. Successful women will speak here today, their stories will inspire you.” Dr. Tuğçenur Ekinci Furtana expressed her pleasure in attending as an entrepreneur, adding, “Our aim is to reach all women in field of entrepreneurship under our university’s roof.” Entrepreneur Kübra Orakçıoğlu Kazan shared her experiences in business world, while GZT Editor Kevser Erbay Lokma Digital Publishing Director Beyza Nur Şahin discussed increasing role of women in digital media.

title: An Innovative Approach to Language Teaching from IZU
content: An Innovative Approach to Language Teaching from IZU 30.10.2024 Our faculty member Assoc. Prof. Dr. Kâmil Arif Kırkıç and IZU master's graduate Dilara Saygın presented their study on impact of digital platforms in language learning at CALICO 2024 Conference in United States. The research explored innovative approaches to effects of artificial intelligence and virtual reality technologies on language education. Assoc. Prof. Dr. Kâmil Arif Kırkıç from Faculty of Education at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University and IZU English Education master's graduate Dilara Saygın presented their study, titled “Voxy as an LXP: How Does it Affect Language Learning in Classroom? Is it a Myth or Reality?” at CALICO (Computer-Assisted Language Instruction Consortium) 2024 conference held at Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) in United States. The conference highlighted innovations in language education brought by technologies such as artificial intelligence (AI), augmented reality (AR), virtual reality (VR), and extended reality (XR). CALICO aims to share latest advancements and applications in computer-assisted language learning (CALL), showcasing contributions of these technologies to language teaching. The presentation, based on a master’s thesis under Dr. Kırkıç’s supervision, examined opportunities technology offers in language instruction, specifically analyzing impact of digital learning experience platform “Voxy” (LXP) on classroom language learning.

title: The phrase translates to "The Distance or Contrast Between Religion and Politics: The Result of Modernism
content: The phrase translates to "The Distance or Contrast Between Religion Politics: The Result of Modernism 09.10.2024 At seminar titled "Modern Images of Relationship Between Religion Politics," organized by our Political Science Club, our faculty member from Islamic Studies Department, İsmail Kara, stated that distance or contrast between politics is a result of modernism. The seminar titled "Modern Images of Relationship Between Religion Politics," featuring İsmail Kara from Islamic Studies Department at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University as a speaker, was successfully held. The event was attended by university's Rector, Ahmet Cevat Acar; Vice Rector, Erhan İçener; Dean of Faculty of Humanities Social Sciences, Mehmet Emin Köktaş. "It is impossible for social values to disregard religion." In opening speeches of program, İZÜ Vice Rector Erhan İçener emphasized importance of relationship between politics in social sphere, stating, "It is an honor for us to have İsmail Kara as part of our Political Science Club's first program." İZÜ Rector Ahmet Cevat Acar highlighted role of in social values. He stated, "We must stay away from prejudices. It is clear that is an indispensable element. It is impossible for social values to disregard religion. Polarization has led us to become a society that engages in unproductive debates. We should evaluate relationship between politics primarily from an objective perspective." "The contrast between politics is a result of modernism." İsmail Kara from Islamic Studies Department at İZÜ explained how distinction between politics has developed in a historical context during his seminar titled "Modern Images of Relationship Between Religion Politics." He stated, "The relationship between politics is a contemporary issue. Before modern era, it was quite difficult to understand separation of politics. The increasing distance between them has led to a contrast rupture, which is a result of modernism. To understand modernization, three key points should be addressed: First, we must discuss modern science philosophy, which are important elements of Enlightenment philosophy. Second, processes of secularism secularization are crucial. Third, capitalism forms underlying thought structure of our daily lifestyle. In this context, capitalism has nothing to do with appearance of freedom." After seminar, participants had opportunity to deeply discuss effects of modernization on relationship between politics.

title: 1. The National CBRN Congress Was Held at İZÜ.
content: 1. The National Congress Was Held at İZÜ. 20.11.2024 The "1st National Congress" themed "Preparedness for Chemical, Biological, Radiological, Nuclear (CBRN) Threats," organized by İZÜ Faculty of Health Sciences, Department of Nursing, was held. The congress focused on discussing measures to be taken against threats in field of healthcare. The "1st National Congress," organized by Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University Faculty of Health Sciences, Department of Nursing, was held at Abdullah Tivnikli Conference Hall. The program, themed "Preparedness for Chemical, Biological, Radiological, Nuclear (CBRN) Threats," was attended by Ayşe Nefise Bahçecik, Dean of İZÜ Faculty of Health Sciences; Levent Kenar, President of Defense Policy Development Association; numerous academics students. In her opening speech, Dean Bahçecik emphasized that purpose of event was to share knowledge experiences about threats. She stated, "CBRN threats involve complex challenges, overcoming these risks requires collaboration among many actors from public sector, private sector, academia, civil society." Levent Kenar, President of Defense Policy Development Association, highlighted that weapons have serious consequences not only in military contexts but also in civilian life. He stressed critical importance of healthcare workers being prepared for these threats noted that congress would contribute to development of effective strategies. ADDRESSED FROM A MULTIDIMENSIONAL PERSPECTIVE In first session of program, experts delivered presentations on threats. Levent Kenar provided insights into chemical threats, Assoc. Gürsel Karahan discussed radiological incidents, Mustafa Nizamettin Erduran covered nuclear threats. Assoc. Mesut Ortatatlı delivered a comprehensive presentation on bioterrorism. The second session focused on preparedness for threats. Samet Kılıç, Istanbul UMKE Coordinator from Ministry of Health, explained medical rescue processes. Seval Dedoğlu from Istanbul AFAD Unit Directorate provided information about Turkey's disaster response plan. Additionally, Sefer Küçük, Istanbul AFAD Team Commander, conducted a demonstration on response processes for incidents. The final session addressed management in emergency healthcare services. Malik Türkay Esin, Deputy Chief Physician of Taksim Training Research Hospital, shared insights on impact on emergency healthcare services. Assoc. Mesut Ortatatlı provided information on a hospital decontamination unit as an example, while Assoc. Aynur Şahin discussed clinical syndromes observed in toxic terrorism emergency management strategies.

title: The Voice of Palestine Echoed at İZÜ
content: The Voice of Palestine Echoed at İZÜ 09.10.2024 The program titled "In 837th Year of Glorious Conquest: The Land of Witnesses, Palestine," organized by Islamic Studies Club Ahdimiz Kudüs Platform, was held at İZÜ. Dean Yılmaz emphasized need for increased anger against oppression in Palestine, stating, "The fire in our hearts grows stronger every day. A brutality leading to death of children continues. Our hope is for Israel's cruel stance to end for this bloody process to cease. Countries in European Union, especially United States, must take action to stop Israel. We, too, must increase our anger against Israel. Our anger needs to grow to counter this oppressive attitude." "We are praying for bloodshed to stop." Writer Bülent Deniz, who conveyed spirit of Jerusalem suffering endured by oppressed Muslims in Palestine, drew attention to Israel's attacks. He stated, "A year has passed, our oppressed brothers sisters are under attack not only from Zionist Israel but also from global colonizers. They are in need of a morsel of bread a sip of water. By slaughtering innocent children, they have chosen a dark path of submission. This is not just a struggle for land; it is a great atrocity unfolding before our eyes. title: Gathered for Palestine on the Anniversary of the Gaza Occupation
content: Gathered on Anniversary of Gaza Occupation 09.10.2024 Role of in Future of Islamic World was Discussed "4th International Conference," organized by Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University, brought together world-renowned thinkers, academics, politicians in Istanbul. Held on anniversary of attacks, conference focused on Palestine's role in shaping future of Islamic world. Center Islamic World Global Relations Application Research (CIGA) at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University organized an important conference on Palestine, which has been subjected to Israeli attacks since October of last year. On anniversary of attacks, renowned thinkers, academics, politicians gathered in Istanbul. "4th International Conference" featured first two days of program at Kaya Istanbul Fair Congress Center, with final day taking place at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University. role of in future of Islamic world was assessed through discussions on first day. World-Famous Thinkers Gathered in Istanbul. program, which began with a recitation of Quran, featured opening speeches by Abdel Razzaq Maqri, Secretary General of Kuala Lumpur Forum Thought Civilization; Sheikh Hassan Ould Al-Dadou, Vice President of Kuala Lumpur Forum Thought Civilization; Issam Al-Beşir, Vice President of International Union of Muslim Scholars; Mehmet Güney, Honorary President of Human Civilization Movement; Prof. Ahmet Cevat Acar, Rector of Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University. "This is a humanitarian issue beyond a religious problem." Prof. Ahmet Cevat Acar, Rector of Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University, stated that a genocide is occurring in Palestine. He noted that Palestinians—children, women, men, sick, elderly—are subjected to horrific massacres. Acar said, "Humanity is watching this genocide live on TV social media. We seen once again who controls organizations like United Nations. Differences in sect, race, language, or tribe should not hinder brotherhood. Our brothers in Gaza conquered their fear. May Allah accept their martyrdom. Let us also acknowledge bigger picture. Our brothers continue to suffer oppression in various parts of world. so-called civilized West is secularizing to extent that Islamic world is unaware. We observed that not only Islamic countries, but everyone who carries human dignity is trying to offer support. This is a humanitarian issue beyond a religious problem." "We will liberate Palestine." Abdel Razzaq Maqri, Secretary General of Kuala Lumpur Forum Thought Civilization, made significant statements regarding rising awakening movements need reform around world. He emphasized that "Israel's oppressive regimes begun to weaken. public's objection to Zionism has grown," highlighting changing political atmosphere. Maqri stressed importance of acting in accordance with thought of Islamic civilization, stating, "We must conduct research collectively. We need to enter a process of self-reflection. To elevate our Ummah, we will move toward common ground. This is how we will liberate Palestine. is a unifying cause. We are in final phase of freedom." "We freed ourselves from cowardice." Sheikh Hassan Ould Al-Dadou, Vice President of Kuala Lumpur Forum Thought Civilization, stated that a new resistance movement is emerging today. He noted, "Cowardice has been a burden carried by our Ummah many years. We freed ourselves from cowardice. We started to express our ideas freely. We are in a battle against an open war on Islam. Our mujahideen sacrificed their lives. Our martyrs been sacrificed this storm. We need everyone's support," calling solidarity. "They are trying to make us forget cause." Issam Al-Beşir, Vice President of International Union of Muslim Scholars, emphasized importance of social unity resistance. He stated, "For a long time, there has been fear over Ummah. Our religion tells us that we must stand against this Zionist entity. It is important all of us to gather in one place say no to sectarian wars. We need to unite against challenges. We must be part of struggle we are waging against enemy. Our Ummah is facing difficulties. They are trying to make us forget cause." "Their struggle is enlightening whole world." Mehmet Güney, Honorary President of Human Civilization Movement, expressed support brothers resisting an independent free Palestine, stating, "Their struggle is enlightening whole world." He added, "I congratulate my brothers who are resisting an independent free Palestine. Their struggle is illuminating entire world. This congress is a step taken on path of Palestinian resistance freedom. I greet all of you who come to Istanbul from around world." "Role of Civil Society: A New Era in Struggle." On second day of symposium, focus will be on Islamic world's response to Aksa Deluge. conference will examine importance of civil society movements in Palestinian struggle, with evaluations on Zionism contributed by Sami Al-Arian Mohsen Saleh. final day of event will take place in Abdullah Tivnikli Conference Hall at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University, addressing "The Impact of Gaza Genocide on International Regional Orders." This topic will be discussed by Sami Al-Arian, Berdal Aral, François Burgat, Mr. Pepe Escobar, Mohammad Marandi, Joseph Massad, Firoz Osman.

title: IZU Students Condemn Israeli Oppression
content: IZU Students Condemn Israeli Oppression 09.10.2024 On anniversary of attacks initiated by Israel in Gaza last October, which have recently expanded to include strikes in Lebanon, protests are being held worldwide. The statement highlighted that Israel targets everyone—young old, hospitals, schools, homes—without distinction, called for global public to unite to stop oppression. It emphasized that Western countries quickly sided with Israel stated that youth, especially on university campuses, must stand together as one voice against tyranny. "Acar: We Are Witnessing a Zionist Brutality Beyond Words." At event, IZU Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar, who walked alongside students, remarked that one of most inhumane oppressions seen by humanity in recent times is occurring in Palestine, where a Zionist brutality continues that words fail to describe. He stated: “Israel has expanded its attacks towards Lebanon Syria. The 2 billion strong Islamic world, 52 Muslim countries, Organization of Turkish States, Arab League have unfortunately been unable to stop this oppression. We are witnessing how United Nations views Muslims with disdain. As some verses have foretold, we are learning that disbelief is a united force. But why is our situation like this? Because Allah commands unity, yet we choose division. As long as this separation continues, we will keep experiencing this humiliation. content: IZU Students Walked for Women Victims of Violence 09.10.2024 Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University students gathered to raise awareness against violence towards women. Akkol expressed that it is everyone's responsibility to stand against violence, stating: "All segments of society should be part of solution against all forms of violence discrimination. Women should feel respect safety they deserve in all areas of society be able to live freely securely. title: The Impact of Artificial Intelligence on Law Was Discussed
content: The Impact of Artificial Intelligence on Law Was Discussed 10.10.2024 Attorney Ali Göksu was guest at conference titled “From Legal Mind to Smart Law,” organized by Faculty of Law at İZÜ. During conference, which was also attended by our Vice Rector Prof. İsmail Küçük and Dean of Faculty of Law Prof. Mustafa Ateş, Göksu discussed importance of artificial intelligence in legal field today and how this technology is transforming legal processes. A conference titled “From Legal Mind to Smart Law: Some Reflections on Redefining Role of Legal Knowledge in Information Society” was held at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University. The program, organized by Faculty of Law at İZÜ in Abdullah Tivnikli Conference Hall, featured Attorney Ali Göksu as a guest. In addition to İZÜ Vice Rector Prof. İsmail Küçük and Dean of Faculty of Law Prof. Mustafa Ateş, event was attended by academics and students. The opening speech was delivered by Dean Prof. Mustafa Ateş, who stated that Göksu's experience in legal practices and his curiosity about technology would greatly benefit participants. Attorney Ali Göksu discussed importance of artificial intelligence in legal field today and how this technology is transforming legal processes. Highlighting changes brought about by digitization, Göksu emphasized importance of data management and effective use of information in legal practice. He stated, “Humanity has been in search of knowledge throughout history. Today, artificial intelligence can be considered a revolution in law. Technology has facilitated access to information and accelerated decision-making process.”

content: Important Announcement for Students in PhD Dissertation Proposal or Dissertation Monitoring Stage in Fall Semester of 2024-2025 30.09.2024 defenses/dissertation meetings for fall semester of 2024-2025 academic year must be held by end of office hours on Friday, December 31, 2024, at latest. Students who exceed this deadline will be considered unsuccessful in their proposals/dissertation stage. thesis documents of PhD students in fall semester must be submitted to Graduate Education Institute by Head of Department by Friday, January 3, 2025 , at latest. (2) committee makes decision on acceptance, correction, or rejection of submitted by with an absolute majority. One month is given for correction. At end of this period, decision made in direction of acceptance or rejection by an absolute majority is notified to Institute by head of department, with a report within three days following end of process. (3) whose is rejected has right to choose a new supervisor and/or subject. In this case, a new committee able to be appointed. who wants to continue program with same supervisor is taken to defense again within three months, who changed supervisor subject within six months. whose is also rejected in this defense is disenrolled from University. time elapsed in these stages is counted from duration of student's PhD education. (5) who does not take defense within time specified in first paragraph without an acceptable excuse is considered unsuccessful, thesis is rejected. Dissertation Monitoring Meetings ARTICLE 23 - (4) For whose thesis is accepted, thesis committee meets at least twice a year, once in January-June once in July-December. submits a written report to committee members at least one month before meeting date. In this report, a summary of study done so far study plan for next semester are stated. student's thesis study is determined as successful or unsuccessful by committee. Students who are found unsuccessful by committee twice in a row or three times intermittently are dismissed from University. thesis report minutes must be submitted by thesis supervisors to Graduate Education Institute with approval of Head of Department through EBYS system. supervisors from outside IZU, must contact relevant Head of Department to submit documents of their students. PhD students who have successfully completed courses, seminars, at least three meetings within their deadlines, have a weighted grade point average of 3,00 above, meet publication requirement can take defense exam.

title: Our Graduate Student Congress has started
content: Our Graduate Student Congress has started 02.10.2024 The "Graduate Student Congress," organized in collaboration with Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University and Ilim Yayma Foundation, has begun at Abdullah Tivnikli Conference Hall. After opening remarks by our Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar, Vice Rector Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener, and Ilim Yayma Foundation General Director İdris Tankut Küsmezer, our guest, Prof. Dr. Zekeriya Kurşun, Vice Rector of FSM Foundation University, delivered a speech titled "Some Assessments on Methodological Issues in Middle Eastern Studies." In his opening speech at congress, Vice Rector of IZÜ, Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener, emphasized opportunities presented to participants. He noted that organizing congress in collaboration with Ilim Yayma Foundation offers significant opportunities for academic careers, stating, “Graduate congresses provide students chance to present their independent work and expand their academic networks. The number of participants is also quite satisfactory.” "We are on path to raising good people." Ilim Yayma Foundation General Director İdris Tankut Küsmezer stated, "Our society, established in 1951, and our foundation, founded in 1973, are dedicated to raising good people. We have carried out activities on this path. We are delighted to meet with our graduate students, who have potential to become scientists of future, under university's roof." "In a scientific environment, Western perspectives are dominant." IZÜ Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar emphasized challenges of conducting research, especially in social sciences. He continued his speech by stating, "We see that Western perspectives dominate scientific environment in Turkey and other Islamic countries. If we, as Turkey, operate solely through viewpoints of American and Western researchers, our risk of reaching similar conclusions increases. Incentives for publications in foreign indexes can leave manipulative traces on scientists. I believe these issues need to be addressed. It is important for graduate students to take responsibility in this matter." "Correctly defining problems is first step in finding solutions." After protocol addresses, opening conference commenced. Prof. Dr. Zekeriya Kurşun, Vice Rector of FSM Foundation University, delivered a speech titled "Some Assessments on Methodological Issues in Middle Eastern Studies." He addressed methodological challenges faced in Middle Eastern studies and emphasized importance of an interdisciplinary approach to resolving these issues. Kurşun noted that correctly defining problems is first step in finding solutions to chronic issues in region.

title: TÜBİTAK Provides Project Support to Kurnaz
content: TÜBİTAK Provides Project Support to Kurnaz 02.10.2024 The 2024 First Term Application Results of the 2218 Domestic Post-Doctoral Research Scholarship Program, conducted by TÜBİTAK's Science Human Support Programs Directorate, have been announced. title: Entrepreneurs Meet with IZÜ Students
content: Entrepreneurs Meet with IZÜ Students 02.10.2024 The conference titled "The Future of Entrepreneurship, E-Commerce, Digital Marketing," organized by our E-Commerce Club, has begun. In opening remarks, IZÜ Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar emphasized changing dynamics of global trade importance of digital literacy, as many entrepreneurs gathered with our students for event. The conference titled "The Future of Entrepreneurship, E-Commerce, Digital Marketing," organized by E-Commerce Club under Health, Culture, Sports Department of Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University, was held at Abdullah Tivnikli Conference Hall. The opening speech was given by Emre Koca, founder of MentorX, who shared his entrepreneurial journey story behind MentorX, highlighting innovations that digitalization brings to business world. Koca stated, "The opportunities offered in e-commerce present a significant chance for students. We see how marketing stands out. The roles of different actors in this process are crucial. I believe we will achieve successful projects together." REKTOR ACAR: INCREASE YOUR DIGITAL LITERACY. In his opening speech, IZÜ Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar discussed globalization e-commerce. He noted that with acceleration of digitalization, entrepreneurs need to develop new business models, stating, "We are in an era where history is rapidly unfolding. Economic activities are conducted on a global scale. Communication transportation have expanded beyond national borders. Smart technologies have swiftly entered our lives. Transportation has become widespread, efficient, fast. As capital accumulation increases, national markets become insufficient. If more functional products can be obtained at better prices abroad, people chase after them. This brings both opportunities threats. Supply chain management will be addressed more comprehensively, marketing e-commerce applications have gained significant importance in today’s competitive global world. Israel's recent use of smartphones in Lebanon is latest example of threats in digital world. We are experiencing a radical transformation together. Artificial intelligence is now writing for us, even coding. E-commerce offers immense opportunities for young people to gain their first entrepreneurial experiences. My advice to youth is to enhance your experiences in digital literacy." Entrepreneurs Shared Their Inspiring Stories. Following Rector Acar's speech, program moved on to its first panel. Moderated by Tuger Akkaya, panel featured İnanç Ayar, Ömer Seyfettin Şener, İsa Korkmaz, who shared their experiences on "Entrepreneurships Shaping Future." The three entrepreneurs provided inspiring examples of how digital transformation new technologies offer strategic opportunities in business world. In second session, moderated by Emre Koca, Furkan Talay, Sedat Akdemir, Batuhan Kızıl discussed "Comparing Organic Traffic Paid Traffic in E-Export." The panelists shared insights with participants on how traffic management in e-commerce digital marketing can be effectively developed through right strategies.

title: The Opening Ceremony Of The 14th Academic Year Of Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University Was Successfully Held.
content: The Opening Ceremony Of The 14th Academic Year Of Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University Was Successfully Held. 25.09.2024 The opening ceremony of 14th academic year at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University was held in museum hall. The event was attended by university's president, Professor Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar, along with vice presidents Professor Dr. Ibrahim Güneş, Professor Dr. İsmail Küçük, Professor Dr. Erhan İçener, Secretary General Dr. Hızır Tutan, as well as members of academic administrative staff. The event also saw a significant attendance from students who were taking their first steps into university life. The ceremony began with Turkish national anthem a moment of silence, followed by screening of a university promotional video. In his opening speech, President Professor Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar expressed his hope that new academic year would be prosperous for students, faculty, administrative staff. "İlim Yayma" is an institution committed to values of our civilization. In his speech, Professor Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar emphasized that Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University is a foundation university established in 2010 by İlim Yayma Foundation, stressing foundation's commitment to values of civilization. Acar said: “For many years, İlim Yayma Foundation has been supporting national spiritual values by providing scholarships accommodation to thousands of students in order to support educational efforts. Inspired by this spirit, Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University offers, with its diverse faculties, departments, international students, library, sports facilities, laboratories, a campus environment that is both at heart of city surrounded by nature. The university is named after Professor Dr. Sabahattin Zaim, who was a pioneer in Islamic economics participation banking. The university continues its educational mission on a campus that has been providing education since 1892 at historic Halkalı School of Agriculture, where our Independence Poet Mehmet Akif Ersoy both studied taught. Our university draws inspiration from these two distinguished figures İlim Yayma Foundation. On this special day, we welcome all our new students wish each of you a peaceful successful academic life."

title: Is Artificial Intelligence a Friend or Foe?
content: Is Artificial Intelligence a Friend or Foe? 25.09.2024 In opening lecture of Faculty of Business and Management Sciences, role and risks of artificial intelligence in education were evaluated. The opening lecture for 2024-2025 academic year at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University’s Faculty of Business and Management Sciences was delivered by Prof. Dr. Veysel Bozkurt, a faculty member from Istanbul University. Titled "The Use of Artificial Intelligence in Education: Opportunities and Risks," program was held in ISEFAM Abdullah Tivnikli Hall. The event thoroughly examined role of artificial intelligence in education, opportunities it presents, and risks it entails. Prof. Yumuşak: Unlimited Use Poses Risks In his opening speech, Prof. Dr. İbrahim Güran Yumuşak, Dean of Faculty of Business and Management Sciences at İZÜ, evaluated impacts of artificial intelligence on our lives. He stated, "The risks brought about by unlimited usage must be taken seriously." Prof. Yumuşak emphasized, "Artificial intelligence is a new field. Alongside its advantages, it carries significant risks. During pandemic, we focused heavily on online classes; however, now we need to discuss consequences of situation. Considering cellphone bans in schools in Germany, we must prevent negative effects of technology on young people." Prof. Bozkurt: Could Artificial Intelligence Bring About End of Humanity? In opening lecture, Prof. Dr. Veysel Bozkurt, a faculty member at Istanbul University, discussed impacts of artificial intelligence on our lives and its potential for future. He noted AI is one of most variable and transformative concepts, highlighting number of people actively using AI technology is increasing daily. Prof. Bozkurt also mentioned there is a significant population perceives AI as a threat, stating, "In a study conducted with a group of 1,500 people, 20% expressed AI would bring about end of humanity. According to analyses, AI is seen as a threat by many. In-depth analyses of this technology are being conducted. AI is with us at every stage of our lives. Whether you use it or not, AI is a part of your life. There is a prevailing perception AI will increase unemployment. So, can AI really bring about end of humanity? I wish we could answer question. How AI will impact our lives depends on technology companies. We need to produce technology belongs to us. This is where our fundamental problem lies. AI is something neither you nor I can afford to give up."

title: Guidance Teachers Gathered at İZÜ
content: Teachers Gathered at İZÜ 25.09.2024 teachers working in Küçükçekmece region gathered at İZÜ to set their strategies for 2024-2025 academic year. The meeting discussed various issues aimed at enhancing quality of guidance services, including prevention of violence in schools. Hosted by Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University (İZÜ), "2024-2025 Academic Year Teachers Meeting" was organized in collaboration with Küçükçekmece District National Education Directorate, Küçükçekmece Research Center, İZÜ Corporate Communication Promotion Department. Approximately 250 guidance teachers from Küçükçekmece district participated in event, which began with National Anthem a moment of silence. The meeting was also attended by İZÜ Vice Rector Dean of Faculty of Educational Sciences, Prof. Dr. İbrahim Güney, Küçükçekmece Special Education Branch Manager Paşali Beşli, Küçükçekmece Research Center Director Tuncay Sabak. GÜNEY: GUIDANCE SERVICES ARE VERY IMPORTANT IN EDUCATION Expressing his pleasure in hosting event, İZÜ Vice Rector Prof. Dr. İbrahim Güney emphasized significance of guidance in education. Güney stated, "The services provided by Research Center (RAM) are extremely important. You all carry out this service with great dedication. I congratulate each every one of you. We take pride in collaborating on projects with our faculty members, administrators, other institutions working in field of guidance supporting them. We always support such activities." PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE IN SCHOOLS WAS ALSO DISCUSSED Küçükçekmece Special Education Branch Director Paşali Beşli Küçükçekmece Research Center Director Tuncay Sabak expressed their gratitude to Prof. Dr. Güney in their speeches. During program, guidance special education activities for 2023-2024 academic year were evaluated. Presentations continued with information about activities to be carried out by Research Center (RAM) in 2024-2025 academic year. The agenda of program included topics such as reviewing counseling programs, planned activities for prevention of violence in schools, psychosocial protection crisis intervention services, evaluation of special education activities.

title: Assoc. Prof. Dr. Mohammed Wadi Entered the Top 2% of the SCOPUS List
content: Assoc. Prof. Dr. Mohammed Wadi Entered Top 2% of SCOPUS List 25.09.2024 Our Faculty of Engineering and Natural Sciences member, Assoc. Prof. Dr. Mohammed Wadi, has succeeded in ranking in top 2% in field of Electrical and Electronics Engineering on SCOPUS list. Assoc. Prof. Dr. Mohammed Wadi from Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University’s Faculty of Engineering and Natural Sciences has been ranked in top 2% in field of Electrical and Electronics Engineering according to "Updated Science-Wide Author Databases of Standardized Citation Indicators" study based on SCOPUS citations. The list evaluates 100,000 scientists from around world and is constructed using a composite indicator (C-SCORE) that includes fundamental factors such as H-index and co-authorship adjusted HM-index, which are of significant academic importance. Expressing his thoughts on this achievement, Assoc. Prof. Dr. Mohammed Wadi stated that he is very happy to announce this important success, and that international recognition of his research serves as a significant motivation for him. Wadi also extended his gratitude to Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University for inspiring him throughout his education, development, and research journey.

title: A Mevlid-i Nebi program was organized at İZÜ.
content: A Mevlid-i Nebi program was organized at İZÜ. 25.09.2024 A meaningful program was held at İZÜ as part of Mawlid al-Nabi Week, marking 1,453rd anniversary of birth of Prophet Muhammad (pbuh). The event took place in Abdullah Tivnkli Conference Hall at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University, attended by our Rector, Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar, as well as a significant number of academic administrative staff students. The program began with recitation of Quran by Hafız Necip Fazıl Belge, an Arabic Preparatory student winner of Quran recitation competition. In his speech, Rector Prof. Dr. Acar emphasized importance of Mawlid tradition in Islamic culture. He highlighted its sociological value, stating: “The Mawlid is an important text that conveys fundamental tenets of Islam exemplary life of Prophet Muhammad to broad audiences. It is particularly valuable in passing on these teachings to younger generations enriching their spiritual lives. Such programs will not only enhance our spiritual world but also strengthen our unity solidarity in face of challenges.” "THE MAWLID AL-NABI IS A REFLECTION OF LOVE AND FAITH" The Dean of Faculty of Islamic Sciences, Prof. Dr. Hasan Kâmil Yılmaz, addressed significance historical context of Mawlid al-Nabi in his talk titled "The 5 Ws 1 H of Mawlid al-Nabi." He emphasized importance of Prophet Muhammad's (pbuh) birthday in Islamic world shared insights about historical origins of programs held on this special day. Yılmaz stated, "Mawlid al-Nabi is a reflection of profound love faith that we hold for life teachings of Prophet Muhammad (pbuh)." MEHMET ÖNCEL AND HIS TEAM PERFORMED A MUSIC RECITAL The program featured a music recital consisting of pieces in form of hymns, performed by Assoc. Prof. Dr. Mehmet Öncel, head of Music Education Department of Fine Arts Education, his team. The event concluded with a prayer by Dr. Adem Ergül. At end of event, a raffle was held where five participants received gift vouchers for use with Turkish Religious Foundation Publications.

content: Academic Writing Training at İZÜ 23.08.2024 İstanbul Sabahattin Zaim University hosted a significant training session on academic writing, conducted by Associate Professor Dr. Mustafa Özgenel as part of the Erasmus+ Core Project. In the morning session, Dr. Özgenel addressed common mistakes encountered in the academic writing process. He emphasized the importance of not only writing a quality article but also choosing the right journal and understanding the submission process. Dr. Özgenel highlighted the critical role of peer review and ethical considerations in scientific processes, offering valuable tips based on his own experiences. The afternoon session featured a workshop led by Associate Professor Dr. Osman Özdemir from the Turkish Education Department at İZÜ. The workshop involved various activities using brainstorming techniques to create different sections of academic papers.

title: IZU Faculty of Education Earns the Right to Use TYÇ Logo!
content: IZU Faculty of Education Earns Right to Use TYÇ Logo! 27.07.2024 Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University's Faculty of Education has earned right to use Turkey Qualifications Framework (TYÇ) logo on diplomas of its Arabic Language Teaching, English Language Teaching, Special Education Teaching, Primary School Teaching, Turkish Language Teaching undergraduate programs. Starting from 2023-2024 Academic Year, TYÇ logo, which signifies high standards quality in education employment both domestically internationally, will be featured on diploma supplements, graduation certificates, transcripts of graduates from these programs. What is TYÇ? The Turkey Qualifications Framework (TYÇ) is a national qualifications framework designed to be compatible with European Qualifications Framework (EQF). It outlines principles for all qualifications acquired through formal, non-formal, informal learning, including vocational, general, academic education training programs from primary, secondary, higher education. TYÇ provides an integrated structure for classifying qualifications in Turkey, ensuring quality assurance across all educational levels learning pathways, including primary, secondary, higher education. Designed in alignment with EQF, TYÇ classifies all qualifications acquired through various learning paths into eight levels. These levels are based on complexity difficulty of qualifications, with Level 1 being simplest Level 8 most complex. Each level is defined by minimum common learning outcomes in terms of knowledge, skills, competencies, known as "level descriptors," which form core elements of TYÇ's design. The level descriptors provide foundation for other structures tools within TYÇ, ensuring a cohesive comprehensive framework for all qualifications in Turkey. For more information about Turkey Qualifications Framework (TYÇ), please visit: https://www.tyc.gov.tr/

title: Specially Digitalised (Special Learning Disability) ERASMUS Project
content: Specially Digitalised (Special Learning Disability) ERASMUS Project 26.07.2024 Specially Digitalised (Special Learning Disability) ERASMUS Project With support of National Agency and coordinated by Istanbul Provincial Directorate of National Education, multiplication meeting for ERASMUS Project titled "Specially Digitalised (Special Learning Disability)" with project number 2020-1-TR01-KA226-SCH-098336, in which Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University is a partner, took place on 05.09.2023. Academic staff from our university, project partners from abroad, and teachers from Ministry of National Education attended multiplication meeting. The goal of project is to develop a digitally supported educational platform for students aged 6-9 diagnosed with special learning disabilities. The multiplication meeting was conducted both face-to-face and simultaneously online. The opening speeches were made by our Vice Rector, Prof. Dr. İbrahim GÜNEY. Following this, Mr. Özer TOPLU, coordinator on behalf of Provincial Directorate of National Education, provided information about project introduction and results. Then, our university faculty member Dr. Nüket AFAT gave a presentation on target audience of project, children diagnosed with special learning disabilities. The last presentation before noon was given by Assoc. Prof. Dr. Aras BOZKURT from Anadolu University, who introduced digital platform prepared for children with special learning disabilities. In afternoon sessions, Romanian team, one of project partners, presented on teacher training and professional development. Following this, Bulgarian team gave a presentation titled "Self-Esteem and Socialization" within scope of children with special needs. Finally, Portuguese team shared satisfaction surveys of students with special learning disabilities who tested digital platform during Transnational Project Meeting held in Portugal. After presenting certificates to project partners and participants, multiplication meeting concluded.

title: The Late Prof. Dr. Sabahattin Zaim Commemorated
content: The Late Zaim Commemorated 26.07.2024 Commemorating Understanding Zaim: An Event Held at Istanbul Zaim University To honor understand esteemed "beautiful person" Zaim, who devoted himself to path of knowledge wisdom, an event was organized in collaboration with Esenler Municipality Youth Sports Services Directorate on Monday, December 4, 2023. The event featured Sedat MURAT, one of his students, as a speaker. The "Sabahattin Zaim Commemoration Event," organized by Faculty of Sports Sciences to coincide with week of our esteemed professor's passing, saw participation from all class levels. The opening speech of event was delivered by Dean of Faculty of Sports Sciences, Zahid SERARSLAN, who emphasized that Zaim should be taken as an example in matter of human development. As part of program, Sedat Murat, who was one of his closest most successful students then Rector of Çanakkale Onsekiz Mart University, currently serving as Vice Rector of Istanbul University, shared many insights about Zaim with participants. In his speeches, Sedat MURAT described Zaim as a perfect human being, patient, well-intentioned, an Ottoman gentleman, someone who should be taken as a role model. The event concluded with distribution of Zaim's book "Bir Ömre Bedel" to students, followed by a book signing session with Sedat MURAT, a group photo. We extend our gratitude to esteemed Sedat Murat for taking time to visit our university helping us understand Zaim, teacher of teachers, better. We remember Zaim with respect gratitude.

title: Meaningful Panel on the Anniversary of Democracy and National Unity Day
content: Meaningful Panel on Anniversary of Democracy and National Unity Day 27.07.2024 On anniversary of Democracy and National Unity Day, Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University held a panel titled "The Victory of a Nation Resisting with Sacrifice." The event, chaired by IZU Vice Rector Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener, featured speeches from IZU Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar, Prof. Dr. Hasan Kâmil Yılmaz, and Prof. Dr. Ergün Yıldırım. Prof. Dr. Hasan Kâmil Yılmaz discussed religious exploitation behind July 15 movement, emphasizing harm caused by misguiding religious sentiments and nation's resistance to such manipulations. Prof. Dr. Ergün Yıldırım analyzed sociological aspects, noting that coup attempt targeted society as a whole and required detailed examination. The panel highlighted Turkey's commitment to democracy and national unity, providing participants with a deeper understanding of July 15's significance. The event aimed to strengthen awareness of these values within national consciousness.

title: IZU 2023-2024 Academic General Assembly Meeting Held
content: IZU 2023-2024 Academic General Assembly Meeting Held 27.07.2024 Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University held its 2023-2024 Academic General Assembly Meeting, attended by university's academic administrative staff. The meeting, led by IZU Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar, Vice Rectors Prof. Dr. İbrahim Güney Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener, involved comprehensive evaluations of university's future goals. In his opening speech, Rector Acar referenced graduation ceremony, saying, "We bid farewell to our graduates with 2023-2024 graduation ceremony. I wish our graduates success in their new lives. I thank all our academic administrative staff for their efforts this year." He congratulated newly appointed promoted academic staff by name, expressing his belief that these changes will greatly contribute to university's academic development. "We continue to take determined steps to enhance quality of our education," Acar stated, highlighting IZU's achievements in education its value to society. He also emphasized university's commitment to not remain indifferent to global issues, pledging to continue raising their voices against injustices, such as resistance in Gaza. Rector Acar reviewed past academic year's successes provided information on goals set for coming year. title: IZU PhD SCHOLARSHIP for TRAINING ACADEMICS
content: IZU PhD SCHOLARSHIP for TRAINING ACADEMICS 25.07.2024 IZU PhD SCHOLARSHIP for TRAINING ACADEMICS Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University will grant 15 PhD scholarships with aim of training academics APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS Applying to a doctoral program at IZU, Applicants must document not being employed in any jobs, Applicants are expected to be willing to participate full-time in university's educational, instructional, research activities. Applicants must have a minimum score of 80 on ALES, minimum score of 156 on GRE, or a minimum score of 590 on GMAT. International students are not required to submit any ALES, GRE, or GMAT scores. If applicants have GRE or GMAT scores, their application will be evaluated after converting them to ALES scores. Applicants must have a minimum CGPA of 3.00 out of 4.00 in their undergraduate degrees a minimum CGPA of 3.50 out of 4.00 in their master's degrees. In Turkish language programs, applicants must have a minimum score of 70 on YDS/YÖKDİL for relevant foreign language or an internationally recognized foreign language score accepted by ÖSYM. In fully or partially foreign language programs, applicants must have a minimum score of 80 on YDS/YÖKDİL for relevant foreign language or an internationally recognized foreign language score accepted by ÖSYM. SCHOLARSHIP INFORMATION Tuition free meal Compulsory General Health Insurance For students staying at IZU Guesthouses or dormitories affiliated with Founding Foundation: Accommodation meal expenses Monthly stipend of 25.000 TL A total of 15 PhD students will be awarded scholarships (10 from Natural Sciences 5 from Social Sciences) Application is open for all PhD Programs at IZU. İstanbul Sabahattin Zaim University İlim Yayma Foundation will grant scholarships. Scholarship/Stipend will be given during regular period of PhD study (4 years) In order to be entitled to Academic Training Scholarship, student must be accepted to programme applied for enrolled in relevant programme. EVALUATION CRITERIA For Turkish applicants: 25% Scientific Exam, 30% CGPA, 10% ALES, 10% Language Score 25% Interview. For international applicants: 35% Scientific Exam, 35% CGPA, 30% Interview The scholarship evaluation committee comprises two academics from IZU one authorized member from İlim Yayma Foundation. HOW TO APPLY? International candidates should submit their undergraduate graduate transcripts, language certificate, ALES/GRE/GMAT score (if they have one), a document or statement indicating they are not employed in Türkiye to email address ayb@izu.edu.tr by end of office hours (17.00 - Istanbul time) on August 7, 2024 . title: Successful Screening and Discussion of "The Night Won't End" at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University
content: Successful Screening and Discussion of "The Night Won't End" at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University 08.07.2024 On July 1st, 2024, Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University's Center for Islam and Global Affairs (CIGA) hosted a successful screening of the documentary film "The Night Won't End," focusing on Gaza. The event, moderated by Üveys Han, featured a discussion with executive producer and co-writer Laila Al-Arian, and cinematographer Ashraf Mashawari. They shared the mental and logistical challenges of filming, including interviews with victims' families and teams on the ground, providing deep insights into the struggles faced by the Gazan people. It was a meaningful evening for all attendees.

title: From Past To Present: GAZA
content: From Past To Present: GAZA 17.02.2025 In program “From Past To Present” held at İZÜ, historical process and current sitiuation of jerusalem and GAZA were discussed. The program emphasized responsibilities of Islamic world. In program “From Past To Present: GAZA”, held at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University, Ahmed Türkistani, international Coordinator of Hayrat Foundation, and Palestinian academic Muhammed Al Azami participated as speakers. The event, orginaized in Abdullah Tiknivli Conferance Hall, began with a recitation from Qur’an by Muhammed El Vadi, a student from Faculty Of Islamic Sciences. Ahmed Türkistani, international Coordinator of Hayrat Foundation, stated they have been actively engaged in humanititrian aid efforts in GAZA since events of October 7. He emphasized that inivatives carried out to support people of GAZA have been conducted with great dedication. Meanwhile, Palestinian academic Muhammed Al Azami shared historcal process of Al-Aqsa Mosque with participants, stressing that Jerusalem should be a top priority for Muslims. He asserted, “Every Muslim must keep jerusalem on their agenda. Jerusalem should be most significant cause in hearts of Muslims. “Al Azami also highlighted importance of fostering historical awareness regarding Al-Aqsa Mosque and Jerusalem. The program reiterated strategic and spiritual signifiance of Jerusalem and GAZA fort he Islamic world, emphasizing once again that ongoing events are a shared concern for all Muslims.

title: The Language Cafe Has Opened
content: The Language Cafe Has Opened 17.02.2025 The Language Cafe Has been inaugurated at İZÜ with aim of enhancing students language skills. Through this Project, students will not only improve their language proficiency but also establish social cultural connections. The openin ceremony of “Language Cafe” Project, launched at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University (İZÜ), has taken place. Organized in collaboration with İZÜ’s Health, Culture, Sports Department (SKS) Youth Office, event was attended by İZÜ Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmed Cevat Acar, Vice Rector Prof. Dr. İsmail küçük, Secretary General Dr. Fatih Hasdemir, SKS Department Head Hülya Şekerci, Corporate Communication promotion Department Head Ömer Çakkal, Libary Documentation Department Head Kasım Çelik, Financial Affairs Department Head Nuri Aktemur, along with academic administrative staff students. “Being Multilingual Is an Important Matter for Our Nation” In his brief speech at opening of cafe, İZÜ Rector Prof. Acar stated , “I would like to thank everyone who brought this wonderful idea to life. Multilingualism is a topic that has always been important to our noble turkish nation. At İZÜ, we provide education in three different languages: Turkish, English, Arabic. Unfortunately, foreign language teaching is often focused solely on grammar linguistic rules. However, this approach can create a dangerous sitiuation in terms of Science education. What is truly important here is ability to communicate connect with people who speak different languages. Thanks to Language Cafe, our students will overcome their fears. Making grammatical mistakes here is allowed ; what matters ,s abilityu to Express oneself. Additionally, our faculty members, who are responsible for Turkish, Arabic English, will provide support to our students.”. SKS Department Head Hülya Şekerci stated that Language Cafe serves as a point of cultural interaction. She emphasized that this enviroment, which offers opportunity to practice in Turkish, English, Arabic, has created a sense of “language brotherhood” among students. Şekerci also pointed out that through this Project, students will not only be able to practice their language skills but also strengthen their cultural connections.

title: Application Requirements
content: Application Evaluation The Admission Committee meticulously evaluates each application for admission scholarship opportunities. Before application reaches the Committee, it undergoes thorough scrutiny by multiple reviewers. We believe in a holistic approach, examining every aspect of application, from academic achievements to personal qualities aspirations. Key Points to Enhance Your Application: 1. Comprehensive Review: Your application is assessed based on various factors, including high school record, alignment of coursework with chosen degree, personal qualities such as leadership motivation, envisioned goals in higher education. We value potential contributions to campus life community engagement. 2. Merit-Based Assessment: We do not rely solely on test scores or GPA. Instead, we consider a broad spectrum of merits, including learning skills, reasoning abilities, cultural impact. 3. Two-Phase Evaluation: Applications undergo two phases of evaluation. Initially, we determine acceptance or rejection. If application progresses to the second phase, we assess scholarship eligibility. Applicants not applying for FULL scholarships are considered for acceptance directly. 100% Scholarship Evaluation Criteria: When applying for scholarships, application should excel in the following areas: - Standardized Test Scores: We accept various test scores, including SAT YÖS. Ensure you provide official scores follow the registration guidelines accordingly. - References : Obtain at least two references through our online application form. Prompt referees to respond to our requests promptly. - Motivation Letter: Craft a compelling letter of intent to showcase suitability for scholarships. Utilize the provided word limit effectively to articulate aspirations achievements. Scholarship Application Tips: - Limited Scholarships: Be aware that scholarships are competitive, with a limited number available. Ensure application stands out by meeting all criteria presenting a strong case for scholarship consideration. Your application journey is crucial, we're here to support you every step of the way. Let achievements aspirations shine through application, seize the opportunity to pave path towards academic success personal growth.

title: IZU PhD SCHOLARSHIP for TRAINING ACADEMICS
content: IZU PhD SCHOLARSHIP for TRAINING ACADEMICS 25.06.2025 Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University will grant 15 PhD scholarships with aim of training academics APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS Applying to a doctoral program at IZU, Applicants must document not being employed in any jobs, Applicants are expected to be willing to participate full-time in university's educational, instructional, research activities. Applicants must have a minimum score of 80 on ALES, minimum score of 156 on GRE, or a minimum score of 590 on GMAT. International students are not required to submit any ALES, GRE, or GMAT scores. If applicants have GRE or GMAT scores, their application will be evaluated after converting them to ALES scores. Applicants must have a minimum CGPA of 3.00 out of 4.00 in their undergraduate degrees a minimum CGPA of 3.50 out of 4.00 in their master's degrees. In Turkish language programs, applicants must have a minimum score of 70 on YDS/YÖKDİL for relevant foreign language or an internationally recognized foreign language score accepted by ÖSYM. In fully or partially foreign language programs, applicants must have a minimum score of 80 on YDS/YÖKDİL for relevant foreign language or an internationally recognized foreign language score accepted by ÖSYM. SCHOLARSHIP INFORMATION Tuition free meal Compulsory General Health Insurance For students staying at IZU Guesthouses or dormitories affiliated with İlim Yayma Foundation: Accommodation meal expenses Monthly stipend of 40.000 TL A total of 15 PhD students will be awarded scholarships (10 from Natural Sciences 5 from Social Sciences) Application is open for all PhD Programs at IZU. İstanbul Sabahattin Zaim University İlim Yayma Foundation will grant scholarships. Scholarship/Stipend will be given during regular period of PhD study (4 years) In order to be entitled to Academic Training Scholarship, student must be accepted to programme applied for enrolled in relevant programme. EVALUATION CRITERIA For Turkish applicants: 25% Scientific Exam, 30% CGPA, 10% ALES, 10% Language Score 25% Interview. For international applicants: 35% Scientific Exam, 35% CGPA, 30% Interview The scholarship recipients will be selected by a commission formed by IZU İlim Yayma Foundation HOW TO APPLY? International candidates should submit their undergraduate graduate transcripts, language certificate, ALES/GRE/GMAT score (if they have one), a document or statement indicating they are not employed in Türkiye to email address ayb@izu.edu.tr by end of office hours (17.00 - Istanbul time) on July 4, 2025 .
