title: Assessment and Evaluation Techniques
content: Assessment and Evaluation Techniques 21.05.2025 On May 20, 2025, a training session on assessment and evaluation techniques was held at the Central Library (KT046). Delivered by Assoc. Prof. Dr. Şaban Berk, the session explored current assessment methods in educational contexts.

title: Veysel Eroğlu Spoke About Abdulhamid II at IZU
content: Veysel Eroğlu Spoke About Abdulhamid II at IZU 21.05.2025 Former Minister of Forestry and Water Affairs Prof. Dr. Veysel Eroğlu Delivered a Seminar on "Understanding Sultan Abdulhamid II" at IZU Prof. Dr. Veysel Eroğlu, former Minister of Forestry and Water Affairs, delivered a seminar titled “ Understanding Abdulhamid II ” at our university. Organized by IZUSEM and held in the Seminar Hall-1 of the Historic Building, the event was attended by IZU Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar, Vice Rector Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener, Secretary General Dr. Fatih Hasdemir, as well as academic and administrative staff and students. During the seminar, the life, political approaches, and historical legacy of Ottoman Sultan Abdulhamid II were discussed in detail. Prof. Dr. Eroğlu shared insights into the Sultan’s knowledge and experience in state governance acquired since his education years, the historical perspective he gained during his travels in Europe, and significant anecdotes concerning key developments of the period.

title: "77 Years of Exile" Exhibition on Display at IZU
content: "77 Years of Exile" Exhibition on Display at IZU 21.05.2025 Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University is hosting a powerful exhibition that highlights 77-year-long struggle of Palestinian people marked by exile, resistance, perseverance. Organized by Center for Islam Global Affairs (CIGA), exhibition coincides with anniversary of Nakba (the “Great Catastrophe”), which began in 1948 continues to this day. It takes visitors on a deeply moving historical journey. The exhibition opened with participation of IZU Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar CIGA Director Sami Al-Arian, features works by Gazan photographer Abdurrahman Kahoot. Through a compelling display of photographs documents, exhibition traces scars left by forced displacement, destruction, loss, life in refugee conditions. At same time, it visually narrates stories of resistance, identity preservation, unwavering determination to return. Each photograph serves as a fragment of an ongoing timeline, inviting visitors into a story that stretches from past into present. This visual narrative not only informs, but also calls on viewers to remember, reflect, bear witness to Palestinian struggle for freedom. With this exhibition, university aims to remind us that these events are not just part of history, but a living experience that continues to resonate within conscience of humanity.

title: Turkish Language Festival Enthusiasm at IZU
content: Turkish Language Festival Enthusiasm at IZU 21.05.2025 The "1st Turkish Language Festival", organized by IZU TÖMER and Turkish Preparatory Program students, was held at Abdullah Tivnikli Conference Hall. The event brought together students learning Turkish as a foreign language and their families on our university campus. The festival began with Turkish National Anthem and a moment of silence. Opening speeches were delivered by Vice Rector Prof. Dr. İsmail Küçük and Assoc. Prof. Dr. Osman Özdemir. They addressed importance of Turkish language education at IZU, foreign students' sensitivity toward language, educational process, and significance of festival. As part of festival, awards were presented to winners of essay competition on topic: "What kind of life would you have lived if you were born as child of a turkish family in Turkey?" Students also performed poems and songs, and a four-act play was staged. Within scope of Turkish Preparatory Program's "Advisory Student Project", certificates of participation were given to faculty students who mentored international students.

title: Türk Hava Kurumu on Its 100th Anniversary of Establishment
content: Türk Hava Kurumu on Its 100th Anniversary of Establishment 22.05.2025 Kemal Yurtnaç, Chair of Trustee Committee of Türk Hava Kurumu (THK), met with students of İZÜ. During program, where Yurtnaç shared good news that three of our students would be offered internship opportunities at THK, three students were also awarded a glider flight experience another three a paragliding experience through a draw. The latest guest of “Hayatımıza Dokunanlar” (Those Who Make an Impact on Our Lives) series organized by SKS Daire Başkanlığı was Vali Kemal Yurtnaç, Chair of Trustee Committee of Türk Hava Kurumu (THK). The opening speeches of program, held at İstanbul Sabahattin Zaim Üniversitesi Nizamülmülk Conference Hall, were delivered by Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar SKS Department Head Hülya Şekerci. Şekerci highlighted that under leadership of Kemal Yurtnaç, institution has been restructured in areas such as youth projects, search rescue operations, raising social awareness. Rector Acar emphasized that young people have much to learn from experienced professionals thanked Kemal Yurtnaç for his participation. YURTNAÇ: “İstikbal Göklerdedir” Is Our Motto Starting his speech by stating that they have adopted Mustafa Kemal Atatürk’s words “İstikbal Göklerdedir” (“The future is in skies”) as their motto, Yurtnaç provided audience with information about structure current activities of THK. He also shared with İZÜ students experiences he gained during his service at Presidency for Turks Abroad Related Communities, his time as Governor, now as Chair of Trustee Committee of THK. In addition to announcing internship opportunities for three students, program also featured a draw in which three students won a glider flight three others a paragliding experience.

title: The Use of AI-Supported Teaching Technologies in Instructional Processes
content: The Use of AI-Supported Teaching Technologies in Instructional Processes 02.06.2025 IZU CELT organized a four-session training program on AI-supported instructional technologies. Led by Dr. Özden Karagöz Mırçık, the sessions aimed to equip participants with the knowledge and skills needed to effectively integrate AI-supported instructional tools into their teaching practices. Throughout the sessions, participants explored practical applications and strategies to enhance learning through artificial intelligence.

title: Volkan Demirel Attends “İZÜ Spor Festivali” as Guest of Honor
content: Volkan Demirel Attends “İZÜ Spor Festivali” as Guest of Honor 23.05.2025 The “İZÜ Spor Festivali,” organized by Turkey’s first student-established sports council, took place with participation of former national football player coach Volkan Demirel. The “Spor Festivali,” organized for first time this year by student members of Sports Council under SKS Daire Başkanlığı, was held at İZÜ Stadium. The content of festival was shaped according to students' preferences. Organized by Turkey’s first student-established sports council, event featured stations such as sack racing, foot tennis, trampoline, boxing machine, giant chess, an archery platform — all of which attracted strong interest from students. The opening ceremony was attended by İZÜ Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar, Vice Rector Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener, Dean of Faculty of Sport Sciences Prof. Dr. Mustafa Zahit Serarslan, Beşiktaş Congress Member Ahmet Çağlar. Supporting Sports Against Digital Addiction In his opening speech, Rector Acar emphasized importance of physical activity in digital age. He mentioned advantages of sports facilities on İZÜ’s campus for students stated that sports should be encouraged as a means of combating digital addiction. Vice Rector Erhan İçener also expressed that İZÜ administration supports sports activities both financially morally takes pride in organizing such events. Volkan Demirel Shares His Experiences The festival, which featured performances by folk dance, taekwondo, archery teams, also welcomed participation of former national football player, sports commentator, coach Volkan Demirel. Demirel shared his experiences in both his football career coaching journey with youth. During event, awards were also presented to İZÜ football, taekwondo, archery teams for their achievements in inter-university competitions.

title: AI-Supported Technology Usage in Research and Teaching
content: AI-Supported Technology Usage in Research and Teaching 19.06.2025 IZU CELT hosted a training session on the use of AI-supported technologies in research and teaching on June 19, 2025. Led by Dr. Mehmet Akın Bulut, the session explored how AI-based tools can support academic research and enhance classroom instruction. The program included both theoretical explanations and hands-on examples demonstrating effective use of artificial intelligence in academic settings.

title: Important Announcement for Students in the PhD Dissertation Proposal or Dissertation Monitoring Stage in the Fall Semester of 2025-2026
content: Important Announcement for Students in PhD Dissertation Proposal or Dissertation Monitoring Stage in Fall Semester of 2025-2026 01.10.2025 defenses/dissertation meetings for fall semester of 2025-2026 academic year must be held by end of office hours on Wednesday, December 31, 2025, at latest. Students who exceed this deadline will be considered unsuccessful in their proposals/dissertation stage. thesis documents of PhD students in fall semester must be submitted to Graduate Education Institute by Head of Department by Monday, January 5, 2026 , at latest. Click here for Graduate Academic Administrative Calendar. Last day for Dissertation Proposal Defenses/Dissertation Monitoring Meetings December 31, 2025 Last Day for Submission of Dissertation Proposal Defenses/ Dissertation Monitoring Documents January 5, 2026 POINTS TO CONSIDER According to IZU Graduate Education Training Regulations; Dissertation Proposal Defense ARTICLE 23 - (1) student, who successfully completes PhD qualifying exam, defends proposal, which includes purpose, method, study plan of research to be carried out, in front of committee, within six months at latest. delivers a written report on to committee members at least fifteen days before oral defense. (2) committee makes decision on acceptance, correction, or rejection of submitted by with an absolute majority. One month is given for correction. At end of this period, decision made in direction of acceptance or rejection by an absolute majority is notified to Institute by head of department, with a report within three days following end of process. (3) whose is rejected has right to choose a new supervisor and/or subject. In this case, a new committee able to be appointed. who wants to continue program with same supervisor is taken to defense again within three months, who changed supervisor subject within six months. whose is also rejected in this defense is disenrolled from University. time elapsed in these stages is counted from duration of student's PhD education. (5) who does not take defense within time specified in first paragraph without an acceptable excuse is considered unsuccessful, thesis is rejected. Dissertation Monitoring Meetings ARTICLE 23 - (4) For whose thesis is accepted, thesis committee meets at least twice a year, once in January-June once in July-December. submits a written report to committee members at least one month before meeting date. In this report, a summary of study done so far study plan for next semester are stated. student's thesis study is determined as successful or unsuccessful by committee. Students who are found unsuccessful by committee twice in a row or three times intermittently are dismissed from University. thesis report minutes must be submitted by thesis supervisors to Graduate Education Institute with approval of Head of Department through UBYS system. supervisors from outside IZU, must contact relevant Head of Department to submit documents of their students. PhD students who have successfully completed courses, seminars, at least three meetings within their deadlines, have a weighted grade point average of 3,00 above, meet publication requirement can take defense exam.

title: About 2025-2026 Fall Semester Doctoral Qualifying Exam Schedule
content: About 2025-2026 Fall Semester Doctoral Qualifying Exam Schedule 20.10.2025 Students who are willing to apply for PhD qualifying exam to be held in Fall semester of 2025-2026 academic year are required to fill out PhD Qualifying application form at https://kampus.izu.edu.tr/login between October 20-24, 2025 . PhD Qualifying Exams will be held on a date to be determined by relevant Head of Departments in December 2025 . The exams will be held at our Halkalı Campus. POINTS TO BE CONSIDERED 1- Students who have successfully completed their courses and seminar, have a cumulative grade point average of at least 3.00 and above, and fulfill Foreign Language Proficiency can apply for doctoral qualifying exam. 2- Students admitted with a master's degree must take doctoral qualifying exam until end of fifth semester at latest in compliance with relevant regulations. 3- In order for students to take PhD Qualifying Exam, they must have a thesis supervisor and choose from “PhD Qualifying Exam” section at https://derskayit.izu.edu.tr/Login 4- Students who applied for PhD Qualifying Examination held in Fall semester of 2024-2025 academic year and did not take exam or failed exam, are required to apply again on specified dates. Students who do not apply will be considered unsuccessful and will be disenrolled from University. 5- Please click here for post-exam procedures of students who are successful in PhD qualifying exam.

title: IZU FOOTBALL TENNIS TEAM BECAME THE SECOND IN ISTANBUL
content: IZU FOOTBALL TENNIS TEAM BECAME THE SECOND IN ISTANBUL 26.04.2017 Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University Football Tennis Team was 2nd in the Istanbul Universities Football Tennis Tournament. Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University, which has won numerous trophies in different dances, has added another success to its successes. Turkey University Sports Federation and Mef University arranged this tournament. IZU Football Tennis Team represented our university and achieved a great victory in the category of ‘Football Tennis’. title: The Final of the ‘Inter-High School Oratory Competition’ Took Place at IZU
content: The Final of ‘Inter-High School Oratory Competition’ Took Place at IZU 01.12.2025 The district final of "Inter-High School Oratory Competition," organized in cooperation with Istanbul Provincial Directorate of National Education İlim Yayma Cemiyeti, were held at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University. The Küçükçekmece district finals of "Inter-High School Oratory Competition," themed "Prof. Sabahattin Zaim Hoca," organized for third time this year, took place in Abdullah Tivnikli Conference Hall. The program was attended by İZÜ Rector Prof. Ahmet Cevat Acar, Vice Rector Prof. Nihat Erdoğmuş, Küçükçekmece District National Education Branch Director Rafet Fener, as well as many teachers students. Delivering opening speech, İZÜ Rector Prof. Ahmet Cevat Acar emphasized importance of using Turkish language accurately effectively. Rector Acar stated, "Our Language holds a vital place in unity integrity of Türkiye. In recent years, shortcomings have arisen such as insufficient value being given to our native language due to focus on foreign language education. Therefore, in order to raise strong competent individuals, we must also be active in social sciences humanities. Developing using Turkish as a language of education science is a national duty.” Küçükçekmece District National Education Branch Director Rafet Fener expressed his satisfaction that competition was hosted by İZÜ. Fener stated: “We are pleased to hold this competition here today, where we will listen to 20 students from 20 high schools in our district. Since theme of our competition is our late teacher Sabahattin Zaim, being at university that bears his name is meaningful for us.” In their speeches, participating students discussed life, ideas, works of Prof. Sabahattin Zaim. As aspiring masters of oratory who embrace Zaim Hoca’s legacy, students showcased their rhetorical skills. The jury members for competition were İZÜ academics Merve Ergüt, Ali Sait Yağar, Nükte Sevim Derdicok, Nurbanu Şahin Hatipoğlu, Necmettin Akay, Research Assistant Safura İnan.

title: IZU ARCHERY TEAM WAS SECOND IN TURKEY
content: IZU ARCHERY TEAM WAS SECOND IN TURKEY 15.05.2017 Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University returned to university as the Turkey second in the 2017 Turkish Inter-University 70M Archery Championship. 188 archery participated to championship from 52 universities. The championship ended with a final shot and a wide awards ceremony on 13 May Saturday. Archery Competition formed with eight different categories. Women’s Classic Team and Women Roller Team won Turkey Second achievement in the championship. Roller Man’s Team and Roller Mix Team completed to championship as a fourth. Afra Aydın, Fatmanur Özkan and Meryem Kutlu represented to IZU in the Roller Women’s Team and Hilalnur Özçırak, Beyzagül Yıldırım and Sümeyye Örs represented to IZU in the Women’s Classic Team. Thus İstanbul Sabahattin Zaim University Archery Team achieved ‘Second Turkey’ in two different categories.

title: Kanat: America at a Crossroads
content: Kanat: America at a Crossroads 01.12.2025 Assoc. Prof. Dr. Kılıç Buğra Kanat, Member of Security Foreign Policies Council of Presidency of Republic of Türkiye, spoke at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University about impact of four major crises United States has experienced over past twenty years on global dynamics. Kanat who is also a faculty member at Penn State University Research Director at SETA-Washington D.C. participated in program organized by IZU Department of Political Science International Relations Politics Club. As guest speaker of conference titled “America’s Longest Twenty Years: The History of America in Four Crises” held at Abdullah Tivnikli Conference Hall, he evaluated how crises U.S. has faced in last two decades have affected state governance foreign policy preferences. Delivering opening remarks, IZU Rector Prof. Dr. Ahmet Cevat Acar underscored importance of hearing such evaluations from an academic who closely observes United States: “Since Second World War, America has been an ally of Türkiye. With its far-reaching global ties, changes happening there leave deep impacts on world politics,” he said. “THE AMERICAN PUBLIC DOES NOT WANT WAR” During session moderated by Vice Rector Prof. Dr. Erhan İçener, Kanat discussed how period beginning with 9/11 continuing through Iraq War, 2008 Economic Crisis, ending with 2020 Covid Pandemic has shaped U.S. governance foreign policy. Highlighting American public’s reluctance toward large-scale foreign engagements, Kanat stated, “To understand today’s U.S. policy, one must carefully examine last century.” He explained how society’s inward-looking tendency influenced elections: “The victories of Bill Clinton, Barack Obama, Donald Trump were driven by their focus on domestic issues during their campaigns. The American people do not want foreign policy to overshadow their own concerns.” KANAT: 9/11 HAS NOT ENDED Kanat pointed out that U.S. experienced crises similar to recent ones in early 20th century, but difference today is that these crises do not reach a conclusion. “Japan’s Pearl Harbor attack was a shock similar to 9/11. In response, America dropped atomic bombs on Hiroshima Nagasaki, Pearl Harbor was over. But despite wars in Afghanistan Iraq, 9/11 has not ended. The other crises America has faced in past twenty years also remain unresolved.” “AMERICA IS AT A CROSSROADS” Noting growing anti-war sentiment in U.S. public sphere, Kanat remarked: “America is at a crossroads. There is a strongly anti-Israel faction, but their anger is not about Gaza; it’s about belief that their country has been dragged into war.” He added that Trump’s plan for 2026 elections points toward a more inward-looking foreign policy. “THE WORLD SYSTEM IS CHANGING” Emphasizing that global system is being reshaped, Kanat stated that political landscape is moving toward a multipolar structure reminiscent of pre–World War II era. Addressing Türkiye–U.S. relations, he noted that ties between two countries have been driven by security concerns since beginning. “In every crisis we have experienced with U.S. since Second World War, Congress has played an active role. In records of Sivas Congress, we see Rauf Orbay complaining about negative stance of American Congress, just like today’s politicians,” he said. Kanat identified two additional key factors straining bilateral relations: relations with Russia weapons policies.

content: All Departments of the Faculty of Business Management Sciences Have Been Accredited by STAR 03.12.2025 All programs of IZU’s Faculty of Business Management Sciences have been accredited by STAR (Social Humanities Fundamental Sciences Accreditation Rating Association). Following the application submitted for all programs that graduated students in 2024, comprehensive on-site off-site evaluations were conducted. As a result, the International Trade Finance (Turkish–English), Islamic Economics Finance (Turkish–English), Business Administration (English), Economics (English) programs were deemed eligible to receive STAR accreditation, which represents quality assurance. The accreditation of all departments within the faculty is significant as it demonstrates that the quality of education, program outcomes, faculty qualifications, infrastructure opportunities, student support, assessment–evaluation processes, institutional operations fully meet the national international standards set by STAR.

title: “Post War Reconstruction of Syria Symposium” Held at IZU
content: “Post War Reconstruction of Syria Symposium” Held at IZU 01.12.2025 The “Post-War Reconstruction of Syria Symposium” was held at Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University. Organized in collaboration with Middle East Foundation, Turkish Journal of International Development, Omran Strategic Research Center, IZU, supported by Presidency for Turks Abroad Related Communities (YTB) TİKA, symposium addressed Syria’s reconstruction process in fields of education, economy, human capital, law. The symposium took place in Abdullah Tivnikli Conference Hall at IZU was attended by IZU Rector Prof. Ahmet Cevat Acar, Vice Rector Prof. Erhan İçener, Omran Strategic Research Center Executive Board Member Ammar Kahf, Middle East Foundation Board Chair Prof. Mesut Özcan, as well as academics NGO representatives from Turkey abroad. ACAR: NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL SUPPORT IS CRUCIAL In his opening speech, IZU Rector Prof. Ahmet Cevat Acar recalled that millions of Syrians were displaced tens of thousands lost their lives during 14-year conflict. He emphasized importance of justice, return of confiscated rights, access to education healthcare in reconstruction process. Acar stated, “Establishing political unity is also very important. The international order represented by UN has collapsed. At this stage, national international support is critical. The failure of Arab countries to fulfill their responsibilities has been a great disappointment. If we do not increase our cooperation, what happened in Syria yesterday could happen to us tomorrow.” KAHF: MORE THAN 50,000 SYRIAN UNIVERSITY STUDENTS IN TURKEY Ammar Kahf, Executive Director of Omran Strategic Research Center, highlighted serious lack of knowledge vision in Syria’s reconstruction. He said, “It is crucial to establish healthy relations with neighboring countries. We are aware of significance of Turkey opening its doors to millions of Syrians. Academic studies will shed light on reconstruction efforts. During war, Syrian academia declined, but millions who had to leave continued working elsewhere. Currently, Turkey hosts over 50,000 Syrian students at undergraduate graduate levels.” ÖZCAN: PROBLEMS CONTINUE IN SYRIA Prof. Mesut Özcan, Chair of Middle East Foundation, emphasized importance of holding symposium one year after Syrian revolution on December 8, 2024. He stated, “Significant change has started in Syria, but challenges questions persist. On first anniversary of revolution, we gathered to discuss what needs to be done to overcome them,” addressing difficulties of rebuilding cities, education, healthcare, other sectors. ÇELİK: RECONSTRUCTION HAS BEGUN RAPIDLY The first session, titled “Rebuilding Human Capital in New Era,” focused on Syria’s education system during reconstruction period. Prof. Zafer Çelik from Yıldırım Beyazıt University noted that a rapid reconstruction process began after December 8. He highlighted ongoing efforts to restructure curriculum, address teacher shortages, improve access to education. Çelik added, “Many projects are either partially implemented or in planning stages with Western countries, Arab world, Turkey. International organizations must honor their commitments to improve infrastructure make education system functional.” ATABAŞ: HUMAN RESOURCES NEEDED FOR SYRIA ARE IN THE DIASPORA Hacer Atabaş from Africa Foundation emphasized role of universities in rebuilding state, restructuring socio-economic policies, ensuring social cohesion for war-affected population, establishing political stability. She noted that 14-year conflict disrupted academic institutions caused a significant brain drain. Atabaş said, “The war destroyed education system. The human resources needed for reconstruction are in diaspora. Hundreds of thousands of Syrians continued their education abroad. If diaspora’s human capital returns, much of workforce need can be met.” DEMİR: ACADEMIC FREEDOM MUST BE GUARANTEED Sociologist Ayyüce Şahin Demir highlighted that higher education in Syria began in 1903 with Ottoman-established medical faculty in Damascus that by 2011, 22 universities were operational nationwide. Despite extensive destruction caused by war, higher education resumed rapidly after December 8. Demir emphasized importance of returning diaspora academics, stating conditions needed: “Academic freedom must be guaranteed. Physical infrastructure should be strengthened, solutions should be developed for housing needs of students academics.” MERT: ACADEMICS READY TO SUPPORT Mehmet Ali Mert from Recep Tayyip Erdoğan University, final speaker of session, discussed role of diaspora academics in reconstruction. He emphasized that political stability is a prerequisite for their return: “State policies are important. Our discussions show that academics living abroad are ready to contribute. In addition to returning, intermediate solutions should also be considered.” The first day of symposium continued with sessions on “National International Dynamics in Reconstruction,” “Reconciling Syrian Society,” “Economic Management Reform,” “Building Economic Infrastructure.” On second day, topics included “Strengthening Private Sector,” “Financing Reconstruction,” “Building Security Structures,” “Compensating Losses Restoring Heritage,” “The Role of Syrian Refugees Diaspora,” “Transitional Justice Legal Reconstruction.”

title: İsmail Hakkı Bursevi on the 300th Anniversary of His Passing
content: İsmail Hakkı Bursevi on 300th Anniversary of His Passing 03.12.2025 The Great Islamic thinker, Celveti sheikh, commentator, poet İsmail Hakkı Bursevi is being commemorated on 300th anniversary of his passing. At panel held at IZU, Mahmut Erol Kılıç Assoc. Ahmet Murat Özel discussed Bursevi's scholarly, mystical, literary legacy. The panel titled "İsmail Hakkı Bursevi on 300th Anniversary of His Passing", organized by Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University Sufi Studies Research Center (İSTAM), took place at Abdullah Tivnikli Conference Hall. Moderated by Hasan Kamil Yılmaz, Dean of IZU Faculty of Islamic Sciences, panel hosted IRCICA Director General Mahmut Erol Kılıç Istanbul Medeniyet University faculty member Assoc. Ahmet Murat Özel. ACAR: "BURSEVİ İS A GUIDING NORTH STAR" Speaking at opening of panel, IZU Rector Ahmet Cevat Acar described İsmail Hakkı Bursevi as "a figure who guides us like a North Star in Today's darkness." Acar said: "İsmail Hakkı Bursevi represents profile of what ancients called 'double-winged'. He was well-versed in rational sciences while also being one of leading figures in spiritual sciences. Recognizing such figures is an expression of respect for spiritual heritage they left behind." YILMAZ: ONE OF THE MOST PROLIFIC OTTOMAN SCHOLARS Hasan Kamil Yılmaz, Dean of IZU Faculty of Islamic Sciences, emphasized Bursevi was among most prolific Ottoman authors. Calling him "a man of balance a profound Sufi," Yılmaz noted Bursevî masterfully used both Arabic Turkish, his tafsir Ruh al-Bayan is considered a significant work among Ottoman scholars. KILIÇ: “SUFISM LIES AT THE FOUNDATION OF THE SCIENCES” Mahmut Erol Kılıç began by reminding audience Sufism was traditionally considered foundation of all sciences in pre-modern world. He pointed out modern era detached itself from this princible, leading to claim each discipline stands on its own. Addressing Bursevi's detailed treatment of concept of inner/esoteric politics, Kılıç said this perspective offered a Sufi conceptual framework for understanding Ottoman state structure. He added Bursevî’s writings across different fields should not be seen as scattered: “In their world of meaning, all sciences serve same purpose. A life or human being without meaning is unimaginable. Spiritual sciences give meaning to concepts. What makes us who we are is this meaning. The role of prophets saints is to breathe meaning back into souls remind us of true essence of religions risk remaining mere rituals.” ÖZEL: “BURSEVÎ IS A RIPE FRUIT OF THE OTTOMAN EMPIRE” Discussing Bursevî’s poetic dimension, Assoc. Ahmet Murat Özel stated Bursevî, as a scholar, commentator, Sufi, traveler, poet, left behind a rich corpus. “Born in mid-1600s, during Ottoman Empire’s stagnation period, Bursevî is a ripe fruit of Ottoman intellectual tradition,” he said. Özel emphasized themes of love spiritual guidance stand out in his poetry, everyday details within his verses offer valuable biographical insights. The program concluded with a musical performance in which ilahis composed from Bursevî’s poems were sung by Mehmet Öncel, Chair of IZU Music Education Department.

content: Teaching Application Research Center Regulation ISTANBUL SABAHATTIN ZAIM UNIVERSITY TURKISH EDUCATION AND TEACHING APPLICATION AND RESEARCH CENTRE REGULATION SECTION ONE Aim, Scope, Basis Definitions Aim 1 - This Regulation has been prepared in order to regulate principles procedures regarding fields of activity, administrative bodies their duties working principles of Teaching Application Research Centre. Scope 2 – (2) This Regulation comprises provisions regarding Teaching Application Research Centre’s administrative bodies, their duties working principles. Basis 3 – (3) This Regulation is based on sub clause (2) of clause (d) of first paragraph of article 7 article 14 of Higher Law dated 4/11/1981 numbered 2547. Definitions 4 – following terms in Regulation have meanings ascribed to them herein: a) Centre (IZUTEM): Teaching Application Research Centre, b) Director: of Teaching Application Research Centre, c) Rector: Rector of University, d) Senate: Senate of University, e) University: University, f) Board: of Teaching Application Research Centre. SECTION TWO Fields of Activity of IZUTEM Fields of Activity 5 – Fields of activity of IZUTEM as follows, a) To establish units at home abroad in order to promote Turkey culture. b) To open courses lecturers teachers assigned to teach at home abroad by relevant state institutions organizations; to have them do internship also to prepare introductory handbooks about country where they will work in. c) To carry out studies to improve language teaching methods applied in teaching departments of universities; to do research applications on language teaching methods. d) To perform comparative studies between foreign languages in order to make teaching more efficient; to develop relevant materials assessment-evaluation tools. e) To organize courses children living abroad. f) To cooperate universities other academic institutions that teach abroad or have relevant departments. g) To teach to students academicians coming as part of interuniversity cooperation protocols. h) To carry out teaching, research, application, publication activities jointly relevant units of universities other state institutions organisations in framework of bilateral agreements made by Turkey. i) To prepare programmes develop methods; to cooperate various institutions organisation at home abroad concerning this matter. j) To issue a certificate in accordance Common European Language Criteria (CELC). k) To teach to foreign students coming as part of European Union projects. l) To teach to foreign students want to study at university, to academicians employees. m) To coordinate language teaching application programs senior students graduate of teaching Language Literature departments of universities. n) To teach to groups individuals within frame of protocols institutions. SECTION THREE Bodies Bodies 6 – administrative bodies of centre stated below. Director. Board. (7) – is appointed by rector from among faculty of relevant departments of three years. View pages for outgoing staff General Information Staff Mobility for Teaching Erasmus+ supports teaching periods at higher education institutions (HEIs) abroad. If you work in higher education, you can spend time teaching at an institution in an Erasmus+ Programme or Partner country. Teaching opportunites are also available to staff working in Programme country organisations. Examples of such organisations include businesses, public bodies, social partners, research institutes. Staff Mobility for Training Erasmus+ supports training periods for staff working in higher education institutions. With Erasmus+, you can train at a higher education institution in an Erasmus+ Programme or Partner country or at an organisation outside the sector in a Programme country. Examples of such organisations include businesses, public bodies, social partners, research institutes and non-governmental organisations.

Hoş geldiniz ”Your arrival is lovely/welcome” Said as a greeting to visitors to make them feel at home. 2. Şeytan tüyü “The devil’s feather” What seems like an insult is actually a compliment used to describe a mysterious, devilish charm. 3. Taş attı da kolu mu yoruldu? “Did he throw a stone so his arm got tired?” Said to berate who’s being lazy. 4. Bir yastıkta kocasınlar they grow old one pillow” By they mean to tell couples to never go to bed angry, is said to newlyweds traditionally share a single, long pillow in a marital bed. 5. Etekleri zil çalıyor “The bells on hems ringing” I recently learned evocative saying used to describe is very excited. 6. Pabucu dama atıldı “His shoe thrown onto roof” Often said of a father a new baby monopolises mother’s attentions, or by anyone passed over in favour of another. 7. Balık etli “Fish fleshed” men usually like women a bit of meat on bones, is a lovely compliment to curvy girls. 8. İyi ki doğdun “It’s good were born” Happy Birthday. I think expression is a lot meaningful than English version, I even use literal English translation on my non-Turkish friends’ birthdays. 13. Boşver “Give empty” Perhaps my favorite saying, Boşver means “let it go,” a la Frozen. 14. El elden üstündür “A hand is superior to another person’s hand” Said to show there’s always do a better job. 15. Battı balık yan gider “A sunken fish goes sideways” one’s pretty hard to parse, but it means worst-case scenario already happened (the fish sunk), so might as well stop worrying some fun! 16. (Benim) ilk göz ağrım “The first pain of my eye” is said to a first love or first child to avoid giving them evil eye (I used to feel very jealous my grandmother said to my brother, her oldest grandchild.) 28. Ellerine sağlık “Health to hand” Said to created something beautiful hands, particularly to a cook or a mom after she’s cooked up a feast her family. 29. Bir musibet bin nasihatten iyidir “One bad experience is worth a thousand warnings” No explanation needed. 30. Güle güle gidin go laughing” is said to departing visitors to help take edge off sad goodbyes.

content: Certificate It certifies that taken is equivalent to in Turkey. You cannot enroll to a university in Turkey without of equivalence. Here is how obtain of equivalence. title: Mobility for Tranieeships
content: Mobility Tranieeships Erasmus + Traineeship Mobility enables student enrolled in a higher education institution to undertake an internship in a company located in one of Erasmus + Program Countries. Traineeship activity is that student obtains practical work experience in field of education. In this context, student is expected to obtain professional training / or working experience in institution where internship is made. Erasmus+ Program Countries United Kingdom, Denmark, The Netherlands, Ireland, Sweden, Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Finland, France, Iceland, Italy, Cyprus, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Hungary, Norway, Poland, Romania, Turkey *, Greece, Germany , Spain, Latvia, Macedonia, Malta, Portugal, Slovak Republic, Estonia, Croatia, Lithuania, Serbia, Slovenia. The grant amounts provided countries are included in application announcements published by Erasmus Institution Coordinatorship. Turkey is a country in Erasmus + program. However, participants selected from our university can not perform their mobility in Turkey. Eligible Institutions / Organizations An appropriate enterprise is an enterprise that engages in all kinds of economic activities,no matter their size, legal status economic sector in which they operate, all kinds of private or public institutions / organizations. A Higher Education Institiution with ECHE (if internship is going to be done at a higher education institution, a bilateral agreement is not a must) Or Any public institution or private institution / organization operating in labor market or in fields of education, training youth. Institutions / organizations internship may be one of following. Small, medium or large private or public institutions or organizations (including social initiatives) A public institution at local, regional or national level A social partner or other representative of business life, including chambers of commerce, trades / professional associations trade unions Research institute Foundation School / institute / training center (including at any level, from pre-primary education to institution of high school post-secondary education (including vocational training adult education) Nonprofit organization, association, NGO Institutions / organizations providing career guidance, professional advice information services Ineligible Institutions/Organizations The following organizations are not eligible higher education internship under Erasmus +: European institutions EU agencies (see https://europa.eu/european-union/about-eu/institutions-bodies_en ) National Agency implementation of EU programs, etc. organizations. Ineligible Mobilities Internship activities academic study cannot be carried out. Internship activity cannot be used to carry out studies such as research assignments, analysis studies on academic studies within scope of a specific curriculum. Students' studies, scientific research projects to complete or support their own scientific studies are not accepted as internship activities. Internship is not work of students who are under supervision of a consultant, who are in thesis period, but who are not covered by internship. Minimum Maximum Durations The duration of activity student traineeship mobility by European Commission is determined as at least 2 months maximum 12 months. However, in order participants to benefit from Erasmus + internship mobility at our university, activity period to be granted is limited to a minimum of 60 days maximum 65 days. The mobility period must be carried out continuously. During mobility, if business is closed because of holidays, it means your mobility gets interrupted holiday period.Grants will be paid period when business is closed, but closed time will not be added to activity period. In order to ensure minimum mobility time, dates of internship to be closed must be investigated in advance it is necessary to ensure that minimum period is ensured even after holiday period is removed. Weekend holidays are not vacation period to be deducted from activity period. In case of student traineeship mobility, when certificate of participation is observed to be active less than 2 months in participation certificate, activity is considered invalid no grant payment is made to beneficiary. The student who has been determined to perform less than 2 months in certificate of participation must return entire grant.

title: Step by Step Registration
content: Step by Step Registration IZU registration dates are in August-September. After being accepted to an undergraduate program at Istanbul Zaim University, should immediately start working on registration. should pay utmost attention to below instructions to experience a smooth process. Remember, registration process is time sensitive. lose accepted status in case are late to register. Be sure to finish registration process in advance. 1 st Step: The Certificate of Equivalence (Denklik Belgesi) The of equivalence certifies that education have taken is equivalent to education in Turkey. cannot enroll to a university in Turkey without of equivalence. Thus, it should be first step registration. Here is how obtain of equivalence. are required to submit original high school diploma transcripts of all years of education to one of following offices: The education counselors education attaché office of Turkey located in country where reside. Please click here to see list of educational attaché in country. may find this office inside Turkish Embassies or consulates. This is easiest, quickest surest way to obtain certificate. By obtaining before travelling to Turkey ensure that are eligible to enroll at a Turkish university. The offices of provincial national education directorate in Turkey. The closest one is located in Sultanahmet District, İstanbul. Work load of ministry in İstanbul spikes on August September. We strongly recommend to apply well in advance . Please click here to see location of Provincial Directorate of National Education. Important : consider this option only if there is not an attaché office in country. If have to apply in İstanbul then this cannot be first step; however, should understand that this is most important document registration. If live in Turkey, this should absolutely be 1 st step 2 nd Step: Payment of Tuition Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University is a non-profit foundation university. It is a type of university that is funded by charity student fee. Therefore, students are required to pay tuition prior to start of classes each semester. are required to present proof of payment at enrolment. The fees scholarships page explains important information regarding payment of fees scholarship. 3 rd Step: Accommodation should consider where to live in İstanbul before coming. If would like to apply IZU Student Guesthouses, should follow its application dates. İstanbul is second largest city in world with number of universities. So may find many options accommodation. 4 th Step: Travelling to Istanbul be allocated with a mentor before travel. It is best if purchase tickets journey with consultation as mentor might want to be there arrival. In case did not obtain of equivalence before travel, we would recommend to arrive in İstanbul at least 3 weeks before end of registration period. be allocated with a mentor before travel. It is best if purchase tickets journey with consultation as mentor might want to be there arrival. In case did not obtain of equivalence before travel, we would recommend to arrive in İstanbul at least 3 weeks before end of registration period. Be mindful of important dates when decide on travel plans. Participation orientation program is not option but a prerequisite registration. It is required to be present at orientation. If do not hold proficiency in language of program, then should take IZU language proficiency exam. Please follow updates regarding dates of proficiency exam as exam not be repeated. We urge to check International Student section of website. find ‘ WELCOME KIT ’ there which is a booklet prepared with much effort to make everything easier you. Our team at international office provided answers to questions might address. shall find every little detail that may be useful in next four to five years. find which door to knock on which request in coming pages. especially find part “how do I succeed at IZU” crucial to learn how to avoid pitfalls be a successful student. Finally, find a brief introduction to life in İstanbul Turkey, which be guide not to survive but to thrive. 5 th Step: Registration Come to IZU Halkalı Campus take along required documents others submitted in application. First, international office check authenticity of documents. Then be directed to office of student affairs where complete registration. Here is list of required documents registration; Acceptance Letter High School Diploma: Original apostilled copy. Transcript: Apostilled, translated, notarized. Passport: Identity validity pages, translated notarized. Dual Citizenship Documents: Relevant certificates. Citizenship Exit Documents: Exit or Blue Card. Entry-Exit Document: Travel dates Turkish citizens studying abroad. Legal Stay Document: Proof of legal stay in Türkiye. Language Proficiency Certificate: Approved by Turkish consulate. Tuition Fee Receipt Passport Photos: Four photos. Signed International Student Commitment Health Insurance: Proof within three months. Students missing original documents must submit them by end of academic year; otherwise, their registration be cancelled without a refund. Please keep us informed throughout process so that we may help you: international@izu.edu.tr

title: Apply to IZU
content: Apply to IZU Application Requirements Applications candidates graduated school or are in final year meet following criteria be considered: Foreign nationals, Those were nationals but later acquired citizenship, Those were born as but later renounced citizenship with permission Ministry of Interior, as well as minor children registered in renunciation document, provided they can certify that they hold Document on Exercise of Rights Granted under Citizenship Law (According to Article 7 of Citizenship Law No. 5901: “(1) A child born in or outside Turkey to a citizen mother father within a marriage is considered a citizen.”), entire in a country (excluding Republic of Northern Cyprus - TRNC) or in located in countries, reside in there with GCE A-Level exam results, as well as enrolled in colleges or between 2005-2010 obtained or are eligible to obtain GCE A-Level results, or entire in a country hold a TR-YÖS exam result. Applications candidates meeting following conditions be accepted: entire in Turkey or TRNC, (except entire in obtained GCE A-Level results, enrolled in colleges or between 2005-2010 obtained or obtain GCE A-Level results, or entire in a country hold a TR-YÖS result), Dual whose first nationality at birth was (except entire in a country excluding or in abroad), Dual citizens, one of whose nationalities is (except entire in obtained GCE A-Level results, enrolled in colleges or between 2005-2010 obtained or obtain GCE A-Level results, or entire in a country hold a TR-YÖS result), former (including Blue Card holders) nationals enroll in institutions 2022-2023 academic year onward (except studying in embassy schools, international private educational institutions listed in MOBİS system, nationals brought to Turkey under projects conducted by Ministry of National Education), or dual whose first nationality at birth was are studying at affiliated with embassies in Turkey or at in Turkey, Those been expelled a higher institution in Turkey due to disciplinary action. Application Documents Candidates must upload following documents to online application form: Application Form (The online application form must be through university's application system), Original a copy of High School Diploma , Official document school (for candidates yet received diploma) confirming that they graduate before university’s final registration date stated in academic calendar (in English or Turkish). If document is provided or graduation date is after final registration date, registration be cancelled , Transcript (An official document listing courses taken grades received in school, approved by relevant school administration. If in or English, it must be translated into one of these languages certified by a notary or a consulate), A copy of a valid identity document showing citizenship information, National or international school graduation exam results (e.g., Abitur, International Baccalaureate, Tawjihi, etc.). A list of accepted exams required scores is provided in Annex-1 , University entrance exam results (if applicable), such as SAT, ACT, TCS, etc. A list of accepted exams required scores is provided in Annex-2 , One passport-sized photo , Proof of legal stay in Türkiye applicants applying within country ( visa-exempt countries, legal stay period must expired ), Civil Registry Record (Vukuatlı Nüfus Kayıt Örneği) dual were born as nationals later acquired citizenship, showing date of citizenship acquisition, along with a Name Equivalency Certificate or Citizenship Acquisition Certificate , Entry-exit records graduated abroad, proving that they were physically present in country while receiving education. Exams Validity Periods (1) High school graduation exams (e.g., General Secondary Education Certification, Abitur, International Baccalaureate, Tawjihi, etc.) no expiration period . (2) University entrance exams (e.g., SAT, ACT, TCS, etc.) are valid two years . title: Student Council
content: Student Council IZU Student Council is composed of volunteers who look after rights of students in providing and improving their education, health, sports and cultural needs of students in our university. Student representatives from Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University come together to form; faculty delegation committees and IZU Student Council, to further develop conditions of our university, to conduct research and evaluation for solutions in education, for research and student services, to present results to relevant units. Note: The tasks listed above are just a few of purposes of committee. The elections for IZU Department Representatives will be held on Wednesday 24.10.2018 in Building of Languages Square (Diller okulu meydanı) between 10: 00-16: 30 for 2018-2019 academic year. For detailed information or application, please contact Department of Health Culture and Sports.

title: Student Clubs
content: Student Clubs We have 33 student clubs active in IZU. In addition to these clubs, we have a total of 9 Students Community's. Student Clubs and Student Communities have the opportunity to work with a team spirit by organizing many activities in; cultural, social, and sports area both inside and outside the campus. The experience and achievements of our students in these club and society activities, form an important place in their educational lives, as they also contribute positively to their professional skills. During the year, various activities such as; conferences, sports tournaments, workshops and trips suitable for the purpose of the clubs are organized. Clubs and Communities work intensively at student festivals held at the end of the year.

title: Counseling and Guidance
content: Psychological Counseling Guidance Psychological Counseling Guidance Unit is a unit affiliated to Department of Health, Culture Sports. The counseling service is provided in office which is in Halkalı Campus. The Psychological Counseling Guidance Unit has two psychologists working full-time part-time. In Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University Psychological Counseling Guidance Unit, purpose is to support students; individual, social, academic professional development as well as to help their adaptation to university dormitory life, to help them gain necessary skills to cope with various problems that may arise during this process. Our Psychological Counseling Guidance Unit helps our students to understand themselves their environment better, helps them to discover their skills to develop their interpersonal communication skills. The academic administrative staff of Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University can also receive individual counseling from Psychological Counseling Guidance Unit. All services provided in Psychological Counseling Guidance Unit are free of charge. All activities carried out in unit are based on principle of confidentiality. However, if life of interviewee or someone they know is in danger, necessary people are contacted, student will be informed about contact. The Issues That Can Be Given Help Through Psychological Counselling (The Issues That Students Might Need Support from The Counselling Office) • Adaptation to University and/or Dormitory • Self-Confidence Issues • Test Anxiety • Fears Anxiety • Negativism Trust Issues • Conflicts within Family • Relationship Issues • Depression • Eating Disorders • Substance Abuse • Similar Issues Above If you are facing any of issues above or similar issues, please contact counselling services between 09:30 – 17:00 Merve ÖZKAN, Psychologist Phone: (0212) 692 9748 E-Mail: ozkan.merve@izu.edu.tr Days Available: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday Huriye ÇEVİK, Clinical Psychologist Office: Health Culture Sports Department Phone: (0212) 692 9748 E-Mail: huriye.cevik@izu.edu.tr Only available on Wednesdays

title: International Collaborations
content: Collaborations The Erasmus + Student Mobility Program is a higher education program aimed at increasing quality of higher education in Europe envisaging "international mobility of university students" by encouraging cooperation between universities from different countries. The Erasmus program is financed by European Union students receives a grant chance to study in different European countries for a certain period of time. The Erasmus program is coordinated by IZU Office. İstanbul Sabahattin Zaim has Erasmus + agreement with 38 universities in 20 countries. Up to now(today), a total of 70 students have successfully completed Erasmus study internship mobility program. Our students benefited from mobility in almost all European countries, especially in Germany, France, Italy Poland. At same time IZU accepts a great number of exchange students from Europe every semester with programs offering 100% 30% English. In addition to Erasmus program, we are developing collaborations with important universities from other parts of world. These cooperation programs include student-academic exchanges, joint symposia conferences, joint research projects, master's PHD’s.Some of these cooperation agreements are; Major American universities such as Duke Mary Washington, our students have opportunity to be a student of change, take (taking)summer courses take(taking) advantage of English language education.For Department of Sciences, where Arabic language education is important,we have agreements with of Jordan World Science & Education in Jordan.In Addition conferences are held every year in with Universiti Utara Malaysia. title: Barkat Atölyesi Yönergesi
content: Barkat Atölyesi Yönergesi İSTANBUL SABAHATTİN ZAİM ÜNİVERSİTESİ MÜHENDİSLİK VE DOĞA BİLİMLERİ FAKÜLTESİ MİMARLIK BÖLÜMÜ BARKAT YAPI ÜRETİM ATÖLYESİ YÖNERGESİ BİRİNCİ BÖLÜM Amaç, Kapsam, Dayanak ve Tanımlar Amaç 1 – Bu yönergenin amacı; Mühendislik ve Doğa Bilimleri Fakültesi “Barkat Yapı Üretim Atölyesi”nde yürütülecek faaliyetlerin tanımlanması ve atölyede yer alan donanım(lar)ın iş sağlığı ve güvenliği standartlarına uygun ve verimli şekilde kullanılması ve sahip olunan imkânların araştırma/eğitime katkı sağlaması ile usul ve esasları düzenlemektir. Kapsam 2 – Bu yönerge, Mühendislik ve Doğa Bilimleri Fakültesi Barkat Yapı Üretim Atölyesi’nin kurulması, işleyişi, geliştirilmesi ve iş sağlığı ve güvenliği standartlarına uygun olarak kullanımı ile düzenlemeleri ve kuralları kapsar. Dayanak 3 – Bu yönerge, Ana Yönetmeliği ve İş Sağlığı ve Güvenliği Yönetmeliği’ne dayanılarak hazırlanmıştır. Tanımlar 4 – Bu yönergede geçen; a) Barkat: Akademisyenlerin araştırmaları ve öğrencilerin eğitimi kapsamında kullanılmak amacıyla kurulan yapı üretim atölyesini, b) Personel: Atölyedeki donanımları kullanmak üzere görevlendirilmiş olan teknisyeni/teknikeri, c) Sorumlusu: Atölyenin iş ve işleyişinin yönetimi ve sağlıklı olarak yürütülmesinden sorumlu olan öğretim elemanını, d) TTO: Teknoloji Transfer Ofisi’ni, e) İZÜSEM: Sürekli Eğitim Merkezi’ni, f) Dekanlık: Mühendislik ve Doğa Bilimleri Fakültesi Dekanlığı’nı, g) İSG Kurulu: İş Sağlığı ve Güvenliği Kurulu’nu h) Rektör: Rektörü’nü, i) Senato: Senatosu’nu, j) Üniversite: Üniversitesi’ni, ifade eder. İKİNCİ BÖLÜM Barkat’ın Amaçları ve Faaliyet Alanı 5 – Barkat’ın amaçları ve faaliyet alanları şunlardır: a) Barkat adlı ahşap yapım sisteminin ve bu sistemin ürünü olarak Bark’ın yapısal ve mekânsal uyarlama ve çeşitlemelerine yönelik araştırma, uygulama ve geliştirme çalışmalarını yürütmek. b) Genelde yapı teknolojisi ve restorasyonu, özelde mimari mirasımız dahilindeki yığma ve ahşap yapım yöntemlerinin araştırma, uygulama ve geliştirme çalışmaları üzerine Ar-Ge faaliyetleri yürütmek. c) Toprak ve ahşap esaslı sürdürülebilir malzemelerin üretimi ve bu malzemelerle yapım teknolojisi üzerine araştırma yapan akademisyenleri bilimsel araştırma projesi geliştirme ve yürütme yönünde cesaretlendirmek ve desteklemek. d) Yapı teknolojisi ve yapı restorasyonu alanında ders materyali geliştirmek. e) Ahşap ve yığma yapım yöntemlerine ve üretimine yönelik, kurumiçi ve kurumdışı yaz okulu, kurs, çalıştay, yarışmalar düzenlemek. f) Özel sektör ve sanayi kuruluşlarının alandaki ihtiyaçlarına yönelik AR-GE desteği sağlamak. g) Özel sektör ve sanayi kuruluşlarının Barkat sistemi, yapısal tasarım prototipi, restorasyon/tadilat, mimari maket gibi ihtiyaçları üzerine üretimler gerçekleştirmek. h) Mimarlık ve İç Mimarlık ve Çevre Tasarımı bölümleri öğrencilerinin maket üretimini desteklemek. ÜÇÜNCÜ BÖLÜM Barkat’ın Kullanım Biçimi ve İşleyişi 6 – Barkat’ın kullanım biçimi ve işleyişi şu şekildedir: a) Atölye’nin öğrenci ve araştırmacılar kullanımı, Ek-1’de belirtilen “Barkat Yapı Üretim Atölyesi Kullanım Kuralları”na uygun olarak, Ek-2’de yer alan “Yapı Üretim Atölyesi’ndeki Donanımı Kullanım Talep ve Açık Rıza Formu” belirtilen sorumlular onaylanmak suretiyle yürütülür. b) Sorumlusunun, Personel ve Stajyer’in İş Sağlığı ve Güvenliği Eğitimine katılmış ve eğitim sonunda yapılan sınavı başarmış olması gerekir. c) İSG Koordinatörlüğü en az yılda kez olmak üzere, Atölye’yi inceleyerek İSG raporunu hazırlar ve Dekanlığa sunar. Rapor, İSG mevcut durum analizi ve güvenli çalışma ortamı sağlamak için yapılması gerekenleri belirtir. d) Öğrenci ve araştırmacıların atölyeyi adil ve verimli kullanmasını sağlayabilmek amacıyla dekanlık öğrenci/kullanıcılara günlük, dönemlik, yıllık kullanım kotası belirlenebilir. Bu durumda, öğrencilerin kullanım kotalarının takibi Personel ve Sorumlusu yapılır. e) Öğrencilerin maket üretimine yönelik 3B yazıcı, CNC kesim ve lazer kesim hizmetine yönelik randevuları Ek-2’de yer alan talep formu üzerinden en geç randevu gününün iş günü öncesinden onaylanır ve atölye sorumlusu belirtilen haftanın iki gününde gerçekleştirilir. Bu hizmetler sınırlarındaki özel sektörde eşdeğer en düşük hizmet bedelinin %10’u kadar düşük olmak suretiyle dönemlik ücretlendirilir. Ücretlendirme atölyenin TTO üzerinden işlem gören banka hesabı üzerinden gerçekleştirilir. İlgili hizmet Personel yürütülür. Atölyenin diğer donanımları Atölyenin müsaitliği ölçüsünde ve Teknikerinin denetiminde kullanıcı gerçekleştirilir ve bu süreç ücretlendirilmez. f) Araştırmacıların atölyenin donanımına yönelik randevuları Ek-2’de yer alan talep formu üzerinden atölyenin uygunluğu ölçüsünde onaylanır. g) Yaz okulu, Kurs, çalıştay ve yarışma talepleri ve bunların yürütücüleri Sorumlusu değerlendirilip belirlenir ve takvimle birlikte İZÜSEM’e bildirilir. Bu faaliyetler İZÜSEM koordinatörlüğünde yürütülür. Barkat Personeli’nin Görev ve Yükümlülükleri 7 – Barkat Personeli’nin görev ve yükümlülükleri şunlardır: a) Personel, atölyenin verimli ve güvenli olarak çalışmasından, atölyedeki donanım(lar)ın kullanımından, bakımından ve temizliğinden sorumludur. b) Personel, atölyedeki donanımların bakım işlemleri için gerekli yedek parça ve sarf malzeme ihtiyacını Atölyesi Sorumlusu’na bildirir. c) Personel, atölyedeki donanıma ait günlük işlem sayısını ve kullanım süresini aylık raporlar halinde Sorumlusu’na sunar. d) Personel’in, yangın ve deprem gibi yaşanabilecek acil durumlarda Acil Müdahale Planı’nı uygulamaya koyma becerisine sahip olması, acil çıkışları erişime açık tutması, yangın tüpü gibi acil müdahale ekipmanları, gerekli uyarı ikaz ve levhalarının uygun şekilde yerinde bulunmasını sağlaması gerekmektedir. Bu konularda Üniversite’nin düzenlediği periyodik tatbikatlara katılmak zorundadır. e) Personel, çalışırken ve donanım(lar)ı kullanırken uygun kişisel koruyucu (gözlük, maske vb.) kullanmak ve kullandırmak zorundadır. Barkat Sorumlusu’nun Görev ve Yükümlülükleri 8 – Barkat Sorumlusu’nun görev ve yükümlülükleri şunlardır: a) Atölyenin düzeninden; verimli ve etkin olarak kullanılmasından sorumludur. b) Atölyenin çalışma düzenini Personel ile eşgüdümlü olarak sağlar. c) Atölyedeki donanım(lar)ın bakım işlemleri için kullanılacak olan ve Personelin belirlediği onarım, gerekli yedek parça ve sarf malzeme ihtiyacını temin edilmek üzere Rektörlüğe bildirir. d) Personel’den alınan aylık raporları yarıyıl (güz/bahar) sonunda Dekanlığa sunar. e) Ticari iş programlarına yönelik teklif ve ihaleleri değerlendirip TTO ile işbirliği halinde yürütülmesini sağlar. f) Yapı teknolojisi ve yapı restorasyonu alanlarına yönelik yaz okulu, kurs, atölye ve yarışmaları talep doğrultusunda planlayıp İZÜSEM ile işbirliği halinde yürütülmesini sağlar. Kullanıcı Akademik Personel ve Öğrencinin Görev ve Yükümlülükleri 9 – Kullanıcı akademik personel ve öğrencinin görev ve yükümlülükleri şunlardır: a) Atölyedeki donanım(lar)ın etkin ve verimli şekilde kullanabilmesi için, Ek-2’de bulunan “Yapı Üretim Atölyesi’ndeki Donanımı Kullanım Talep ve Açık Rıza Formu”nun öğrenci/araştırmacı kullanıcılar doldurulması, Sorumlusu ve Dekanlık onaylanması gerekmektedir. İşlem tarihinden en az (1) gün önce randevu onayı alınmış olmalıdır. b) kullanımı için randevu almış, ancak randevusuna gelemeyecek kullanıcıların en geç (1) gün öncesine kadar iptal/değişiklik talebinde bulunmaları gerekir. c) Öğrenci kullanıcıların işlem (kesim, kazıma vb.) yapılacak dijital çizim dosyalarının, Personel’in belirttiği şekilde (ölçekli, çerçeveli, vb.) ve formatta (dxf, dwg, vb.) hazırlanması gerekir. Kullanıcıların işlem yapılacak sarf malzemelerini kendisi temin ederek atölyeye getirmesi gerekir. d) Kullanıcılar EK-1’de yer alan kurallara uymalıdır. Öğrenci kullanıcıların herhangi şekilde Maket Atölyesi’nde bulunan donanım(lar)a zarar vermesi, donanım(lar)ı kullanımı tespit edilirse, öğrenci kullanıcıların atölye kullanımı sınırlandırılır ve hakkında disiplin işlemleri uygulanır. e) Atölyenin 3B yazıcı, CNC kesim ve lazer kesim olanaklarından uzun vadeli (bir dönemde üçten fazla kez) yararlanacak olan araştırmacıların yayınlarında atölyenin olanaklarından yararlanıldığının bahsedilmesi beklenir. DÖRDÜNCÜ BÖLÜM Çeşitli ve Son Hükümler Personel ihtiyacı Yönetmelikte hüküm bulunmayan haller 10 – Bu Yönetmelikte hüküm bulunmayan hallerde 2547 sayılı Kanun ve diğer mevzuat hükümleri uygulanır. Yürürlük 11 – Bu Yönetmelik yayımı tarihinde yürürlüğe girer. Yürütme 12 – Bu Yönetmelik hükümlerini Rektörü yürütür. Ek-1. Yapı Üretim Atölyesi Kullanım Kuralları İş sağlığı ve güvenliği ilkelerine; uyarı levhalarına uyulmalıdır. Atölyedeki araçların kullanımında önlük, gözlük, eldiven vb. uygun iş giysisi giyilmelidir. Gevşek, tam giyilmemiş ve yırtık giysi; terlik, sandalet, topuklu ayakkabılar; yüzük ve saat benzeri takılarla girilmemelidir. Bu tür kişisel eşyalar, çanta ve mont benzeri kıyafetler vestiyer/askılıkta bırakılmalıdır. Eğitimi alınmamış cihazlar kullanılmamalı, atölye sorumlularına danışılmalıdır. Bir cihazı kullanmadan önce işlerliği ve bağlantılarının uygunluğundan emin olunmalı ve acil durdurma düğmesinin yeri öğrenilmelidir. Planlanan iş dikkatle, ciddiyetle ve vaktince yerine getirilmelidir. Atölyede yalnız çalışılmamalı; delici-kesici aletlerle ve atölyede çalışan başkasıyla güvenli mesafe bırakılmalıdır. Bozuk olduğu düşünülen veya iş sırasında bozulan/aksayan aletlerin onarım ve bakımına girişilmemeli, derhal atölye sorumlusuna bildirilmelidir. İşe ara verildikten veya iş bitirildikten sonra kullanılan aletlerin kapatıldığından emin olunmalı ve kullanılan aletler, çalışma alanı ve çevresi temiz bırakılmalıdır. Üretilecek iş için sarf malzeme atölyeye getirilmeli ve iş bitiminde kalan artık/atık malzeme ayrıştırılarak kutu ve dolaplara konulmalıdır. 3 iş günü içinde alınmayan iş ve sarf malzeme atölyenin ihtiyarında kullanılır. Atölyeye ait olan herhangi araç-gereç dışarıya çıkarılmamalıdır. Ek-2. Yapı Üretim Atölyesi’ndeki Donanımı Kullanım Talep ve Açık Rıza Formu 1. title: Tercih İndirimi
content: Tercih İndirimi 2025-YKS yerleştirme sonuçlarına göre, Üniversitemizin lisans programlarına yerleşen öğrencilere, tercih sıralaması ve programa göre %40 ile %15 arasında değişen oranlarda “Tercih İndirimi” uygulanacaktır. Tercih İndirimi, öğrencinin kayıtlı olduğu programın azami öğrenim süresi boyunca geçerli olup detaylı bilgilere Üniversitemizin Aday Öğrenci web sitesinden ve Burs Yönergesi’nden ulaşabilirsiniz. * 2025-2026 akademik yılından itibaren hem yeni hem mevcut tüm öğrenciler için ÖSYM burs ve indirimleri ile tercih indirimleri, kaydolunan lisans programının azami öğrenim süresi boyunca geçerlidir. ÖSYM ve Tercih Burs ve İndirimlerine İlişkin Bilgi Notu: Aşağıdaki öğrenciler, "ÖSYM" ve "Tercih" Burs ve İndirimlerinden yararlanamazlar. Bu öğrencilerin kayıtları "Ücretli" programa yapılır ve tam öğrenim ücreti tahsil edilir: İlgili akademik yılda Üniversitemizde kayıtlı iken veya kaydını sildirerek yeniden sınava giren ve ÖSYM tarafından Üniversitemize yerleştirilenler. Daha önce herhangi bir örgün lisans programından mezun olanlar. Üniversitemiz tarafından verilen tüm burs ve indirimler hakkında detaylı bilgi için Üniversitemiz Burs Yönergesini inceleyiniz >>>

title: Hizmetler
content: Hizmetler Kafeteryalar Öğrencilerin beslenme ve ders dışı zamanlarında dinlenmelerine ve eğlenmelerine yönelik olarak, kampüsümüzde muhtelif kantin ve kafeteryalar bulunuyor. Bulunduğu konum itibariyle, yeşil bir doğanın içerisinde yer alan kafeterya ve kantinlerimiz, öğrencilerimiz için ayrıcalıklı ve güzel bir buluşma noktası. Kafeteryalarda öğrencilerimizin eğlence, dinlenme ve beslenme ihtiyaçlarını karşılamaya yönelik hizmetler veriliyor. KAFETERYA ÇALIŞMA SAATLERİ Yemekhaneler Üniversitemizin Halkalı Kampüsünde gıda hizmetleri, ISO 9001, OHSAS 18001, ISO 22000 kalite belgesine sahip özel bir yemek firması tarafından verilmektedir. Yemekler, Üniversitemiz mutfağında hijyenik bir ortamda üretilerek ve çoktan seçmeli menü üzerinden, self servis usulüne göre sunulmaktadır. İZÜ Yemekhanede, haftanın 7 günü 11:00 ile 15:00 ve 17:00 ile 20:00 saatleri arasında hizmet verilmektedir. ARALIK 2025 ÖĞLE YEMEK LİSTESİ ARALIK AKŞAM 2025 YEMEK LİSTESİ Kırtasiye ve Fotokopi Hizmetleri Üniversitemizin Halkalı Kampüsünde faaliyet göstermekte olan kırtasiye tarafından öğrencilere fotokopi, print out, renkli baskı, kitap ve çeşitli kırtasiye malzemeleri satışı başta olmak üzere, hafta içi 08:00 -19:00 ve Cumartesi günleri 09:00 - 15:00 saatleri arasında hizmet verilmektedir. (Vize ve Final haftalarında ise hafta içi 08:00 - 22:00 ve hafta sonu 08:00 - 19:00 saatleri arasında hizmet verilmektedir.) Ekiplerimiz, günlük olarak koridor temizliği, sınıf ve ofis temizliği, çöplerin toplanması, camların temizliği, tuvaletlerin temizliği yapılmakta ve tekrarlanır nitelikte olması; normal dışı beklenmeyen bir kirlenmenin oluşması durumunda buna müdahale edilmesi, okulun ara dönemlerinde tüm kampüs ve yerleşkelerin detay temizliğinin yapılması; kampüs genelinde yapımı tamamlanan binaların kaba ve ince temizliklerinin yapılması; fakülte ve birimlerin giriş kapı camlarının silinmesi ve periyodik olarak belirlenen fakültelerin iç ve dış cephe camlarının temizliği; konferans salonları ve fuaye alanlarının günlük olarak programlar takip edilerek temizlenesi ve konferans, sunum, panel, oturum vb. organizasyonlar için hazırlıkların yapılmasını sağlıyor.

title: Özel Bağış Bursu
content: Özel Bağış Bursu Madde 19 - (1) Üniversite öğrencilerini desteklemek amacıyla gerçek veya tüzel kişiler tarafından yapılan bağışlar, öğrencilerin ödemeleri gereken öğrenim ücreti üzerinden indirim yapılarak veya öğrenciye nakit ödenerek kullandırılır. (2) Bu bursların verileceği öğrenciler, sağlanacak indirim oranları ve ödenecek nakit tutarlar bağışın kapsamına uygun şekilde Üniversite Burs Komisyonu kararı ile belirlenir. Bu burs ve indirimlerin toplamı, bağış amacına tahsis edilen tutarı aşamaz. (3) Bağışların kullanımına ilişkin esaslar bağışçının şartlı bağışına uygun şekilde veya bağışçının herhangi bir şart öngörmediği hallerde Üniversite Burs Komisyonu tarafından belirlenir. (4) Üniversite Burs Komisyonu, bağışların kullanımı ve dağıtımı hakkında bağışçılara talep etmeleri halinde bilgilendirme yapar. title: Sıkça Sorulan Sorular
content: Sıkça Sorulan Sorular İZU E-Posta Nasıl Kullanılır? Lisansüstü programlarda gören öğrencilerimizin destek ve bilgi talepleri sadece " std.izu.edu.tr " uzantılı e-posta adreslerini kullanmaları zorunludur. Şahsi e-posta adresleri istenen bilgilere cevap verilmeyecektir. " std.izu.edu.tr " uzantılı e-posta adresinden gönderilen mailler de, numarası tc kimlik numarası, ad-soyad ve program adı bulunmalıdır. Bu bilgileri eksik öğrencilerin maillerine cevap verilmeyecektir. Üniversitemizden size tanımlanan e-posta adresine yapılan tüm bilgilendirmeler resmi tebligat niteliğindedir. Bu nedenle e-posta hesabınızı kullanmanız ve sürekli kontrol etmeniz gerekmektedir. Derslere devam zorunluluğu var mı? - Öğrencilerin sınavlara girebilmeleri için, derslerin %70 ’ine devam etmiş olmaları Kaydımı dondurmak istiyorum. Ne yapmalıyım? Haklı ve geçerli sebeplerin varlığı halinde, anabilim dalı başkanlığının ve enstitü yönetim kurulu kararı boyunca, yüksek öğrencileri en fazla , doktora öğrencileri ise en fazla dört dondurabilir. Haklı ve geçerli sebebin edilebilmesi, bu sebebin ortaya çıkmasından itibaren en ay enstitü müdürlüğüne bildirilmesi şartına bağlıdır. Kayıt dondurma başvuruları, başında ve işlemlerinin tamamlanmasından itibaren en ay yapılabilir. Kaydı dondurulan öğrencinin, o yarıyıl, süresine dâhil edilmez. Aynı usulle dondurma işlemi tekrar edilebilir. Dilekçe tıklayınız. Kaydımı sildirmek istiyorum. Ne yapmalıyım? Kendi isteği Üniversiteden kaydını sildirmek isteyen öğrenci, dilekçe ve ilişik kesme formu birlikte enstitü müdürlüğüne müracaat eder. Kayıt sildirme işlemi posta yoluyla yapılamaz. Öğrencinin bizzat yazılı müracaatı Ancak, özel hallerde ve mali yükümlülüklerin yerine getirilmiş olması şartıyla, noter kanalı belirlediği vekil Üniversiteden kaydını sildirebilir. Kayıt Silme Dilekçesi Kayıt sildiren ÖĞRENCİ’nin İZÜ’ye ödediği ücretinin iadesi ve/veya kesintileri aşağıda belirtilen şekliyle yapılır: Akademik takvimde belirtilen ders başlangıç tarihinden önce sildiren ücreti varsa kesilen fatura/faturalar nedeniyle devlete ödenen katma değer vergisi mahsup/tahsil edilerek kalan tutar iade iptal edilir. Birinci yarıyılın ilk (2) haftası içerisinde sildiren öğrenciden, ücreti üzerinden %15 oranında kesinti yapılır. Birinci yarıyılın ilk (2) haftasından sonra sildiren ücreti üzerinden aşağıdaki tabloda belirtilen oranlarda kesinti yapılır. YARIYIL (YY) TEZSİZ YL. KESİNTİ ORANI TEZLİ YL. KESİNTİ ORANI DOKTORA PROGRAMI KESİNTİ ORANI 1.YY’ın üçüncü haftasından 2.YY başına sürede 1/3 1/4 1/8 2.YY – (3.YY başına sürede) 2/3 2/4 2/8 3.YY – (4.YY başına sürede) Tamamı 3/4 3/8 4.YY – (5.YY başına sürede) Tamamı 4/8 5.YY ve sonraki yarıyıllarda Tamamı ALES Puanının geçerlilik nedir? -ALES Puanının geçerlik 5 yıldır. Sınav Notlarıma nasıl itiraz edebilirim? - Sınav notlarına itiraz, sınav notlarının ilanını takip eden beş gün enstitü müdürlüğüne dilekçe başvuru yapılır. Daha önceki Üniversitemde aldığım derslerden muafiyet talebinde bulunabilir miyim? - Daha önce YÖK denkliği edilen herhangi yükseköğretim kurumunda görmüş öğrenci, o yükseköğretim kurumunda alıp olduğu dersler için, anabilim dalı başkanlığına not belgesinin aslını ve ders içeriklerini teslim etmeli daha sonra kampüs bilgi sisteminden ders muafiyet talebinde bulunmalıdır. - Öğrenci, muafiyet talebini Üniversiteye kaydını yaptırdığı ilk yarıyılda derslerin başladığı tarihten itibaren en beş gün yapmak zorundadır. - Sonraki yarıyıllarda yapılacak muafiyet talepleri ya da yapılan muafiyet/intibak işlemlerinin iptaline yönelik talepler edilmez. -Muafiyet verilen dersler (İZÜ’de alınan dersler hariç) ücret iadesi/indirim yapılmaz. Ancak; Bilimsel Hazırlık Programlarında muafiyeti verilen ders/derslerin ücretleri yüksek lisans/doktora programlarının ücretlerinden mahsup edilir. Bilimsel Hazırlık Programının en fazla kaç dönemdir? - Bilimsel hazırlık programında geçirilecek en çok yarıyıldır. - Yaz öğretimi bu süreye dâhil edilmez. Bu dondurma dışında uzatılamaz ve sonunda olamayan ilişiği kesilir. - Bu programda geçirilen yüksek doktora programı sürelerine dâhil edilmez. - Bilimsel Hazırlık Programı kapsamında ders alan sildirmesi halinde ücret iadesi yapılmaz. Lisansüstü Programlarda tezimi istediğim dilde yazabilirmiyim? - Lisansüstü programlarda tezler, Türkçe Programlarda Türkçe İngilizce; - Kısmen yabancı dilde programlarda Türkçe dilde, - Tamamen yabancı dilde programlarda programın dilinde yazılır. Lisansüstü Programlarda Askerlik Tehir İşlemleri Nasıl yapılır? Tecil ne kadardır? -Lisansüstü Programlara yapılırken sevk tehir tarihini gösteren son ay tarihli Askerlik Durum Belgesini Enstitüye teslim eden her sevk tehir işlemleri yapılır. -Doktora Programlarında tecil 6 yıl, -Tezli Programlarında tecil 3 yıl 4 ay, -Tezsiz Programlarında tecil 1,5 yıl, olarak yapılmaktadır. Not : Daha önce aynı düzeyde herhangi lisansüstü programdan olanların Askerlik Sevk Tehir işlemleri yapılmamaktadır. Lisansüstü Programlarda kayıtlı öğrencilerin sevk tehirleri azami 35 yaş sonuna yapılmaktadır. Kayıtlı olduğu programın azami süresini aşan öğrencilerin sevk tehirleri yapılmaz. Kayıt Dondurma işlemi yaparsam Askerlik tecil süremi nasıl etkiler? -İlgili Enstitü Yönetim Kurulu kaydı dondurulan öğrencilerin dondurma süreleri azami öğrencilik sürelerine eklenir ve bu süreler de öğrencilerin askerlik sevk tehir işlemleri yapılır. -Askerlik tecili açısından, dondurma süreleri hiçbir koşulda yüksek programlarında 1 yıl, doktora programlarında ise 2 yılı geçemez. Lisansüstü Programlardan Mezun olduktan sonra Askerlik tecil sürem devam eder mi? -Yüksek Programlarından olanların tecilleri Askerlik Şubeleri mezuniyet tarihinden itibaren 1 yıl süreyle ertelenmektedir. -Bu haktan faydalanmak isteyen mezunlar, mezuniyet belgeleriyle birlikte Askerlik Şubelerine müracaat etmelidirler. -Doktora Programlarından olanların ise, mezuniyet nedeniyle sevk tehiri yaptırmalarına yasal imkân bulunmamaktadır. İlk celp döneminde askere alınırlar. Diplomamı almak istiyorum, ne yapmalıyım? - , İlişik Kesme bölümünden ilişik kesme işlemini başlatmanız ve birimlerin onaylaması gerekmektedir. Daha sonra onay detay sayfasının alt tarafında yer alan birimlerin onay verdiğine dair evrakın çıktısını alıp, imzaladıktan sonra diplomanızı almak bu belge birlikte Enstitü Sekreterliğine başvuru yapabilirsiniz. Not: Geçici Mezuniyet Belgesini almış olanlar bu belgenin aslını diploma alırken iade etmek zorundadırlar. Geçici Mezuniyet Belgesi 2020-2021 Bahar dönemi itibariyle verilmemektedir. e-Devlet üzerinden belgesi alınmaktadır. Normal içerisinde tezimi tamamlayamadım. Ek ne yapmam gerekiyor? - Kayıtlı olduğu programı, normal içerisinde başarı tamamlayamayan öğrenci, daha sonraki yarıyıl(lar)da, İZÜ belirlenen (1) ders ücretini ödeyerek dilekçe Enstitü Müdürlüğüne başvuru yapıp ek talep edebilir. Tezli Programının kaç dönemdir? -Tezli yüksek programının bilimsel hazırlık programında geçen hariç, olduğu programa ilişkin derslerin verildiği yarıyıldan başlamak üzere, her yaptırıp yaptırmadığına bakılmaksızın dört olup, program en çok yarıyılda tamamlanır. Tezli Programında Danışmanımı ne zaman belirlemeliyim? Danışman yapabilir miyim? danışmanının en birinci yarıyılın sonuna belirlenmesi Öğrencinin ve/veya danışmanın enstitüye yazılı başvurusu üzerine anabilim dalı başkanlığının ve enstitü yönetim kurulu onayı yapılabilir. Ulusal uluslararası bilimsel toplantılarda sunulmuş bildiri, Hakemli/indeksli dergide yayınlanmış, yayına edilmiş DOI numarası alınmış makale, İZÜ'nün Sosyal/Fen alanlarında düzenleyeceği sempozyumlarda sunulmuş bildiri. Tezli Programında Önerisini ne zamana vermem gerekir? -Öğrencinin danışmanıyla beraber belirlediği başlığını birlikte en ikinci yarıyılın sonuna Enstitüye teslim etmesi Önerisi Formu Tezimi Savunma Aşamasına Geldim. Ne Yapmalıyım? Detaylı bilgi tıklayınız. Tezsiz Programının kaç dönemdir? -Tezsiz yüksek programını tamamlama süresi, bilimsel hazırlık programında geçen hariç, olduğu programa ilişkin derslerin verildiği yarıyıldan başlamak üzere, her yaptırıp yaptırmadığına bakılmaksızın en az yarıyıl, en çok üç yarıyıldır. Tezsiz Programlarında Proje Danışmanımı ne zaman belirlemeliyim? Danışman yapabilir miyim? Ancak 6/2/2013 tarihinden önce tezsiz yüksek programlarına kayıtlı öğrenciler doktora programlarına başvurabilir. Programının kaç dönemdir? -Bilimsel hazırlık programında geçen hariç, tezli yüksek derecesi edilenler olduğu programa ilişkin derslerin verildiği yarıyıldan başlamak üzere, her yaptırıp yaptırmadığına bakılmaksızın sekiz olup, azami tamamlama on yarıyıl; derecesi edilenler on olup, azami tamamlama on dört yarıyıldır.
